reviewText:
Red is a pretty fun ride from start to finish. It features a great cast, including Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Mary-Louise Parker, Richard Dreyfuss, Ernest Borgnine, Brian Cox and Karl Urban. The Expendables is another movie that came out this year with a huge cast, but I never would have thought that these older folks would make for a better action movie.

The humor, which works a little over 50% of the time, and the strong cast are what really makes Red tick. Some of the action scenes are interesting, like when Bruce Willis gets out of a moving car and starts shooting without missing a beat, while others are rather bland. The story felt flat and simple, yet at the same time, all over the place. Still, there is no doubt that for an early fall release, Red proves itself better than most of the average films I've seen this summer.

RED is the action-comedy about a small group of retired CIA field operatives (Retired, Extremely Dangerous...R.E.D.) who are targeted for elimination by nefarious government groups and must team up to fight off the threat and reveal the culprit.

RED is a silly but very fun movie.  It is the sort of movie that would not work, however, if we didn't already have pretty strong impressions and feelings about its stars.  If we didn't already think of Helen Mirren as the classy actress who won an Oscar for THE QUEEN...we wouldn't laugh simply at the sight of her wielding a machine gun.  If we didn't mostly think of Morgan Freeman for playing God or the President or the silky-toned narrator of MARCH OF THE PENGUINS...we wouldn't chuckle at his antics.  Quite frankly, if you enjoyed the trailers for RED, you'll enjoy the movie.  They give you an almost complete sense of the tone of this film.  If you thought the trailers looked merely silly and made you roll your eyes...then the movie will simply multiply that feeling.

Personally, I thought it was a lot of fun.  The actors are clearly having a ball, and Bruce Willis (who doesn't really come across as old enough to be retired...especially when he can still win fistfights left and right) makes a good host.  He's coasting here, but as movie-goers, we're so comfortable with Willis and his shaved head that it feels a little like we're just visiting an old friend.  Mary Louise Parker (WEEDS) is his sort-of love interest, a call center worker he's been flirting with long distance but who now joins in on the escapades.  She does a nice job evolving from meek to really enjoying the dangerous antics.  Mirren and Freeman are fun.  Brian Cox shows up as a retired Soviet agent, and he sparkles in his over-the-top accent.  Richard Dreyfuss appears in a couple of scenes and chews scenery.  You have to almost feel sorry for Karl Urban as the assassin on Willis' trail...he doesn't get to have much fun...but he acquits himself well.  I can almost envision him doing well as the star of a straight-laced action series on CBS.

Best of all is the hilarious John Malkovich.  He steals every scene he's in with amazing ease.  As the craziest of the REDs, he gets to let his tendencies to overact mightily just run wild...and it all works.  His facial expressions alone had the audience in stitches.

RED is not a classic film by any means.  But I must say, the 110 minutes I spent with these guys was a complete, guilty-pleasure blast.  Maybe I'm just the right age (46) to enjoy this particular cast goofing around...but I sure noticed a lot of happy looking teens and 20-somethings all around me.  I think this film is set up to be a nice little hit (with room for sequels).

We loved this movie! I previously rated it 5-stars! We missed it in the theatre and borrowed the Special Edition version from our local library. The SE has some great extras on it!

I have just contacted my 2nd Amazon seller, who sold me a NON-Special Edition copy! No extra features! No problem, you'll get a refund once you return the "wrong" version DVD! Yeah, Right! I'm wasting my time (and money) with vendors who don't give a crap whether I get the DVD I ordered or not! No, I don't get all my money back, because I no longer trust these sleazy vendors to claim I even sent their mistaken DVD back! So I end up paying for delivery confirmations!

Buyer Beware! Amazon used to have some decent 3rd party vendors. My experience says otherwise!

Yeah, I purchased two copies of this DVD, but I never got even one, and I'm out money! Screw me very much!

RED (Retired, Extremely Dangerous) is an entertaining, slightly off-beat action-comedy about a group of former CIA black ops agents targeted for assassination.

Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) lives the quiet desperation of retired suburban life, his only outlet is a budding phone romance with Sarah (Mary-Louise Parker) a Federal Pension clerk.  Out of the blue a team of high-tech assassins suddenly comes after him, setting him on the trail to find out why.  Sarah becomes embroiled in the mess from her connection to Frank as he tracks down his old partners Joe (Morgan Freeman) and Marvin (John Malkovic), who are also on the hit list.  To ensure the success of the mission the CIA brings in a rising young star named Cooper (Karl Urban) to complete the job.  Along the way Frank enlists the aid of a former KGB operative Ivan Simanov (Brian Cox) and former MI6 asset Victoria (Helen Mirren) to unravel the conspiracy against them, which goes higher than they could have imagined.

The film is based upon the DC Comics graphic novels, which I was unaware of, so I don't how it measures up to the source material.  The script is fun and funny with lots of characterization and backstory to help tie things together.  The little things add up: Frank's trying to connect better with Sarah by reading the same books she does, Frank and Ivan reminiscing about the old days and other small scenes like these help bring it up a notch above the standard fare.  The whole movie is fun and energetic, with the certain level of silliness you'd expect from it, but a couple of times it lands in the wrong places.

The actors were good in their roles but Morgan Freeman's screentime is too brief and Mary-Louise Parker's character reminded too much of Nancy from Weeds.  But they all play off each other very well, and I wasn't expecting the appearances of Cox, Richard Dreyfuss, Julian McMahon, Ernest Borgnine and James Remar- any of whom are a bonus.

One of the best things about the movie was the music.  A nice mix of Chicago Blues, southern guitar and R&B bass is used for transitions and travel music, and there's a little Aerosmith and some good funky riffs thrown into the action sequences all of which work nicely and sound great.  Go over to the website and you'll hear a couple of riffs: [...] This is a soundtrack I definitely want!

RED is an entertaining popcorn flick with some nice laughs and ok action.  The draw is more in the star power than the story.  Don't expect too much out of it and you'll enjoy it for what it is.  Better than a three but not a four.

It's hard to make a good action film. It's even harder to make a good comedy. And it's harder still to tell a story that will not only entertain audiences, but also keep them intrigued. Not only does "Red" successfully achieve all three, it also manages to house it within the context of a graphic novel, a notoriously fanboy-exclusive genre. Fanboys will certainly appreciate this film, but so, I believe, will general audiences; apart from being a fun, thrilling comedy caper, it's also a thoroughly absorbing tale of conspiracy, friendship, loyalty, and yes, even romance. It displays a fair share of comic book violence, and yet it never becomes overpowering, so we can simultaneously revel in the stunts and explosions and pay attention to the plot. It's nice to know that even comic adaptations can be made to appeal to everyone and not merely exist in a closed universe.

Adapted from the graphic novel by Warren Ellis and Cully Hamner, "Red" tells the story of four retired CIA agents who have been marked for death. Exactly who wants them dead and why, they don't yet know. It all begins with a former black-ops agent named Frank Moses (Bruce Willis), who, despite his impeccable service record, has been labeled RED - Retired, Extremely Dangerous. Up until a team of assassins entered his home, he had been living the quite life in a secluded suburban area. He had started a phone relationship with Sarah (Mary-Louise Parker), who tries to manage his pension from a cubicle in Kansas City; it proved to be an unwise move, for now she's also a target for assassination. Frank kidnaps her for her own good. She's initially frightened by him, although it very quickly becomes apparent that she gets off by living dangerously. She's also one of the few people outside of his inner circle that can handle his witty banter.

The death of a newspaper reporter leads to the discovery of a long hit list. This, in turn, leads to Frank reuniting with his old teammates: Intelligence specialist Joe Matheson (Morgan Freeman), who languishes in a New Orleans retirement home; spy and camouflage expert Marvin Boggs (John Malkovich), who lives in bomb shelter in Pensacola and, after years of undergoing Russian mind-control experiments, has every reason to be hopelessly paranoid; and Victoria (Helen Mirren), now a domestic Martha Stewart-type in Chesapeake, although she often yearns for her old days as a Wetwork special ops agent, where she was proficient with long range weapons. Together, they work towards uncovering a massive conspiracy, one that connects to an assignment they were a part of years earlier.

On their tails is CIA agent William Cooper (Karl Urban), who seems to understand his mission less and less the more he learns about Frank and his team. Far from a villainous clich, he's a family man who's dedicated to his job yet does possess the ability to think rationally; he's methodical and cunning, but he's also capable of making mistakes, and the more he realizes what Frank is capable of, the less he's inclined to listen to his superiors and carry out his mission. He also realizes, rather harshly, that both he and Frank have the wherewithal to fight for who they love.

The film deftly manages a balancing act between action violence and comedy, helped in no small part by actors who are quite funny. Malkovich is the obvious example, his character a wacky explosion of goofy dialogue and sheer mental instability. But Willis, Freeman, and Mirren shouldn't be forgotten, here; they too reveal a refreshing sense of humor, mostly in relation to how their characters have adapted - or at the very least, have tried to adapt - to retired life. Credit also to Parker, whose surprisingly realistic dialogue is the perfect counterpart to Willis', which is pleasantly silly. Ironically, it's the mildly serious nature of the story that allows the leads to be so funny; had the film been a nonstop joke fest, had there been not a shred of heavy-handedness, the subtle quirkiness of the characters would not have registered. They simply would have disappeared into the background.

Fortunately, the filmmakers found a way to keep every aspect of the movie engaging. Nothing is left to the sidelines, not even the occasional stunt sequence, each lasting long enough to be entertaining but not going on so long that they become boring. Perhaps the best extra touch is a small but memorable guest appearance by Ernest Borgnine, who at age ninety-three looks, moves, and sounds like an actor twenty, nay, thirty years his junior. As the film's tagline says, "Still got it." Everyone involved with this film has got it. 2010 has seen the release of several comic book/graphic novel adaptations I enjoyed, including "Iron Man 2," "The Losers," and "Scott Pilgrim vs. the World" (I'm conveniently forgetting the deplorable "Kick-Ass"). "Red" is by far the best of them all. It's funny, exciting, and absorbing - a thoroughly entertaining film.

Sure, Bruce Willis kicking ass is nothing new but add Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich "not as a villain for once" and Helen Mirren kicking ass too and you're in for a good time. While Mary-Louise Parker is adorable and funny as Sarah Ross, who finds herself on a blind-date from hell with Willis' character. Red may overstay it's welcome a little bit, but I enjoyed it and I wish any of the 2010 summer releases were this fun.

I love the movie.  When I first watched it, I laughed out loud many times, and I hadn't done that during a modern comedy in awhile.  There was also a happy surprise included in that there was a code for a digital redemption included in the case.  I was super excited (because who doesn't like digital copies?) until I went to redeem it... and it was expired (hence the 3 stars instead of 5 - it would've been 2 stars had the case indicated a digital copy was included).  But I didn't actually get a notification saying it was expired, the website just kept popping up an error message stating "Something went wrong, try again."  After SEVERAL times retrying (and trying using Vudu's normal digital code redemption page vs the link included on the insert), I decided to give up.  In their defense, the insert does state "Offer must be redeemed on or before 6/13/2014 or your code will expire."  But even taking that into account, most digital codes I've redeemed have been a couple of years beyond their expiration dates but were still good.  I've considered contacting the Blu-ray manufacturer, but I know the chances are slim-to-none of getting a valid digital copy redemption code.

To sum up, I LOVE this movie (as stated before).  The movie itself is worth 5 stars, but the lack of a valid digital copy redemption code took it down to 3 stars.

Red is available for the first time on 4K Ultra HD. Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) is a former black-ops CIA agent living a quiet life alone until the day a hit squad shows up to kill him. Besides Frank, other retired CIA agents are being targeted by parties unknown. With his identity compromised, Frank reassembles his old team  Joe Matheson (Morgan Freeman), Marvin Boggs (John Malkovich), and Victoria (Helen Mirren)  and sets out to prove that they still have the field skills to handle the bad guys.

Director Robert Schwentke strikes an often uneasy balance between strictly action thriller elements and broad humor, but overall, the film is fun, especially when Dame Helen Mirren appears long into the film to perk things up. Seeing her handle a 50-caliber machine gun is a hoot. Mary Louise Parker stars as Sarah Ross, the telephone contact charged with ensuring that Franks pension checks arrive on time.

The film is available for the first time on 4K Ultra HD, which provides over four times the resolution of full HD and delivers the brightest, most vivid and truest color with the greatest contrast. The 4K Ultra HD Blu-ray release also features Dolby Vision and Dolby immersive audio, providing a theatrical experience for home viewing.

Bonus features on the 2-disc Red 4K Ultra HD/Blu-ray release include audio commentary with retired CIA field officer Robert Baer, and deleted and extended scenes.

Just finished watching "Red" released by Summit Entertainment.
Based on the graphic novel published by DC, "Red" is a fun cross country romance adventure about Frank Moses, a retired CIA Black OPS Specialist who is trying to fit into retirement by living quietly in suburbia, while trying to work up the courage to ask the young lady who works for the US Department of Pensions as a Customer Service Representative out on a date - he speaks to her once a month, deliberately tearing his pension checks in half so that he can have an excuse to call her.
Moses then wakes up one night as intruders break into his house late one night with the intent to kill him.  He takes them out and immediately goes on the run.  Someone is trying to kill him and Moses must rescue his potential girlfriend before she becomes collateral damage.
"Red" is a light-hearted spy rump that also does double duty as a romantic comedy.
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Willis is the Star supported by an All-Star cast of equally big-names like Malkovich, Mirren, Freeman to name just a few. The sequel was equally enthralling and it's a shame the plans for Red 3 seem to have fallen through.

Willis in one of his best! RED stands for Retired, Extremely Dangerous, at least is does in this story about a former CIA operative. He led a mission into a latin country to rescue a big-wig's son and now only Willis and three others remain alive out of ten members. Mary-Louise Parker steals much of the film as a government pension coordinator whom Willis treats as a love interest... that is after he drugs and ties her up because she's not reacting how he wants. Picture her tied to a headboard of a bed in a small motel. She breaks loose and calls the cops. But the cops turn out to be looking for Willis. Malkovich is excellent as a conspiracy theorist who lives his fears. Morgan Freeman is another retiree who has to kill an assassin right after a visit from Willis. Helen Mirren romps through the story as a retired MI6 agent who had to kill her Russian lover. Brian Cox plays her supposedly dead lover and Karl Urban is the CIA agent charged with killing Willis. Great fun!

A fun, nonstop action comedy.  Bruce Willis is at his best as Frank Moses, a retired CIA black ops agent who is being hunted by a hit team because of his involvement in a covert mission some years before involving (spoiler alert) the current Vice President.  No one can give a good rant like John Malkovich's LSD-addled character and Morgan Freeman is excellent as his sane, rational counterpart.  Helen Mirren as a contract killer is a departure from her normal characters and she does it in her usual excellent way.

I'm laughing just thinking about some of the scenes with John Malkovich as a paranoid ex-agent who turns out not to be so paranoid.  This movie leaves you feeling happy and satisfied.  Highly recommend.

Somewhat enjoyable Geriaction film which sees retired black ops operative Bruce Willis romance the stone with Mary Louise Parker, as they're both dragged into a plodding espionage caper. Overlong and sloppily edited, the film offers an engaging set up and some neat action beats, but it's charms have worn thin by the time Helen Mirren pops up an hour in, and have positively evaporated by the time the film itself wheezes to a conclusion an hour after that. See it if you're as bored as Bruce Willis appears to be in this.

I'd give it only 1 star for wasting the superb Morgan Freeman, who has enormously more to offer than he's allowed to provide in most roles (cf. his stellar "buddy" performance as Azim the Moor in Costner's Robin Hood remake, where his humor and expressive power are allowed to shine).

But aside from the horrible waste of Freeman, I found this to be a 5-star film, so I had to compromise.

Helen Mirren is her usual superb self.

Malkovich plays his paranoid character for laughs, but real paranoia isn't funny at all, nor are its sufferers.

Willis, of course, is always Willis in much the same way that other well-known actors (e.g. Alan Rickman) always play themselves.  It's hard to argue with success.

This film bears so little resemblance to the graphic novel that they should have not kept the title. But that's Hollywood for you, no respect for Droit Moral at least where the right of integrity of the original work, which was a dark and poignant tale of loyalty and sacrifice betrayed, is concerned. Sure the original work was way too short to sustain a full-length film but any extension to the story could have been consistent with the original mood and in that way the colossal plot holes in the movie might have been avoided. Robert Baer's commentary was a little painful to listen to and I hope they gave him a big, fat cheque for his time - he must have really needed the money.
On the positive side of the ledger, it is a really enjoyable romp with a fine cast who never needed to get out of first gear so effortless were their performances. Just remember to turn your brain off.

Given like for movies/shows are so individual, I generally do not write reviews for movies. But this is one of my favorite movies so I just have to. To give you an idea of my personal tastes, I like action movies and I like comedies. I find movies with neurotic characters to be hilarious. RED is about as ridiculous as it gets. It has neurotic. It has a whole lot of psychotic. It has a ton of action. It's filled with both direct, implied, and neurotic humor. And it actually has a plot which in and of itself is interesting beyond the action and comedy sequences.

As many awesome reviews here talk about the movie itself in detail, I am going to focus on just a few aspects and not at a level of detail that would give away how the movie works. Specifically, I am going to focus on some of the characters and how they relate to the plot.

The characters chosen could not have been better. Obviously any movie can have an "all-star" cast, but how well the cast brings the movie to life really depends on if the actresses and actors excel in roles played in that specific kind of movie. Here it was done flawlessly.

Bruce Willis is known for his action, perhaps first made legendary in Die Hard. In more recent movies like the Expendables 2, his action has merged with comedy (for example, him and Arnold Schwarzenegger driving around in an electric golf cart shooting a small army of bad guys while simultaneously complaining about old age and talking trash). Willis has the neuroticism you want from someone playing this role, but with the ability to deliver in the 'kick ass' department that you need for an action movie. So for the main character, he's golden.

But that isn't enough to make a good cast given it takes more than one character. Needing someone capable of taking neurotic to (and beyond) psychotic, John Malkovich is perhaps the best actor for this job and delivers solid deadpan neuroticism you can't help but laugh at. And while all the characters are pretty neurotic, he is by far the most and one of the comedic reliefs in the film. His excess of neuroticism and intense paranoia make him a strong comedic relief in a movie that is, largely, already funny (and that's often difficult to do, and when done poorly, can really detract from the movie.)

Morgan Freeman (arguably one of the greatest actors in history) is capable of filling almost any acting role and he does so perfectly here. Mary-Louise Parker is the other comedic relief in the film. While the least psychotic of the characters, she brings a different kind of awkward, mismatched, and suggestive humor that the other characters do not, and the movie itself would not be nearly as funny without her. Like some of her other acting roles, there is a lot of applied humor. Karl Urban does a good job at the wildcard. His seriousness contrasts the seriousness of the other characters, and his interactions with the other main characters makes them more funny. Helen Mirren and Brian Cox bring very unique roles and have very good on-screen-chemistry that matches the ridiculousness of the movie rather than being serious to a point where it overshadows the base insanity that defines RED. The chemistry between Bruce Willis and Mary-Louise Parker is also excellent. All of the romance adds to the action and the comedy, without pushing the movie on a drama path.

The plot in and of itself is actually interesting, and this is where many action movies (and especially action-comedies) tend to fall short on. It maintains a story line that in itself as not ridiculous in a fashion that the characters are, and it orders the events in a fashion in which you actually know what the film is doing, where it is progressing, but without being able to predict the outcome ahead of time. You won't have a "what the heck just happened?" moment or a "15 minutes in, I knew what was going to happen and it did."

The special effects in and of themselves are pretty awesome. Like most bigger budget action flicks, you won't be disappointed here.

Overall, I really like the movie and can watch is time after time. If you like this style movie, I think you will find it to be entertaining to a level of excess in ridiculousness with a degree of humorous neuroticism that few movies can match.

CONS:

This is a brilliantly funny action movie with very wide appeal. I couldn't resist adding my superlatives to the long list of positive reviews, especially since I have watched this DVD recently for the third time. Even the extra features are interesting!

All the main players are in top form and their obvious chemistry adds so much to the generally upbeat mood. They are having a ball and not taking themselves too seriously, while poking fun at a series of events which are both topical and credible. We learn from the extras that an ex-CIA agent oversaw the production and it shows!

The story begins with a look at the life of early retiree Frank Moses (Bruce Willis at his sardonic best), and it is immediately clear that this freakishly neat, mild-mannered man has secret depths. He calls to complain about his pension payment being late, but this is a blatant excuse to chat up his caseworker (competently portrayed by Mary-Louise Parker). It becomes clear that, despite their age difference, they have both been enjoying these conversations for some time and soon, with some misgivings, she agrees to meet Frank in real life.

From here on, the action takes off as Frank's past catches up with him and, facing mortal danger, he is forced to re-assemble a team of his former associates.

John Malkovich gives an unforgettable performance as a mentally-damaged but still sharp former CIA operative (I'm getting the PIG); Helen Mirren is equally fantastic as the gun-toting ex-spy who is unable to make a complete transition to her new life as the suave hostess of a luxury guest house (I take the odd contract on the side. I just can't stop.). Brian Cox is priceless in the role of a love-sick Russian agent and manages to steal many scenes (But you didn't come just for the vodka). Morgan Freeman is both touching and hilarious and Karl Urban deals expertly with his conflicted character. Ernest Borgnine brings a life-weary, seen-it-all, deep humanity in a superb cameo appearance. I could go on, as there isn't a weak performance in this whole movie and the stunts and special effects are nothing less than spectacular.

The movie moves along at a lively pace and there are surprises right up to the end. This is a true comedy, a rare gem in a wasteland of hyped-up funny films that simply aren't amusing, to me anyway, and I have enjoyed it more each time I have watched it.
This is a good quality DVD.  The movie is great and worth adding it to your collection.  Funny!  Never a dull moment.

Even the other stars seemed to try to create a reason for their role. Over acting is worse than bad acting. They were pushing that. However, Nicolas Cage and Al Pacino are the masters of overacting. John and Morgan were pushing it to create a reason to be there.

Lots of machine guns, car crashes, and all the other things these types of films usually have. Some nice locations and the production values are very good. The storyline is implausible at best, about a group of retired CIA agents now targeted by the corrupt vice president who is a puppet of a bad guy business man who is at the bottom of this sometimes slap stick, sometimes soapy, always loud way to waste an evening. Anyhow the geriatric guys manage to fight off hundreds of buff young current CIA soldiers and agents in various settings and eventually kill off all the bad guys and win the girls. Surprise, surprise.

The baby boomer adventure movie to end all boomer adventure movies (you can practically hear Willis, Mirrin, Freeman, and Malkovich yelling, "Take that, generation Y! We're still vital and relevant!!!" as the credits roll) the premise of this movie is that spies might be retired, but they are still plenty dangerous. It's a fun idea, executed competently, if not especially brilliantly. Willis gets to play a slightly edgier version of his rogue cop role, a la Die Hard; Malkovich gets to be wacky; Mirrin gets to be classy (and British, of course); and Freeman gets to be wry. Mary Louise Parker serves as the romantic interest, playing a more midwestern version of her Nancy Parker (Weeds) character.

The plot is straightforward, and everything hinges on the star power of the cast. Since they're all strong actors, it mostly works. If you have a family gathering, with grandparents and kids and parents all itching to watch a movie - this is a good choice. Nothing offensive, but nothing too juvenile, either.

This isn't intended to be a negative review - movies like this one are hard to find. There's precious little out there that's good for older kids (think late elementary school through middle school) and also palatable for adults. This is a solid movie that promises just what it delivers: entertainment.

We sat and watched this DVD and roared with laughter between, and sometimes amidst, heart-pounding action.  With a star list list this one has of course the acting was superb.  How much did we like it really?  Well, we went on to Red 2 immediately and repeated our enjoyment.  This is a MUST SEE!
I had seen the movie before and wanted to own it because I enjoyed it, lots of action and twists.
The movie is full of action tons of unnecessary violence and a lot of humor so if you are a fan of any of those things watch it
Action packed and lots of good humor and fun. I do not like violence but this film seemed to make light of it so it was just part of the story and not too serious.
Really good movie and I'm thrilled to have it as part of my collection. Great acting with awesome intense scenes.

Consider this: Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Mary-Louise Parker and Helen Mieren in one great movie.
It is funny and hysterical and not a chance that you will miss one moment of this great film.
Irony and loves of their past lives of being black ops and the best at what they did, back in the day.
Now we find them R.E.D.  (Retired, extremely dangerous.)
Don't miss this one it is fun to watch and great laughs.
Didn't think I would enjoy this movie, but I was well worth it and if you're looking to be entertained, this  is the movie for you!
too much gun fire and explosions. great cast. did not flow smoothly. I am a man of few words don'tcha see.

We enjoyed this movie at the theater and laughed a lot.  We had sort of forgotten all the details and since our 10 year old Grandson says it is one of his favorites...we decided to get it so that we could watch it again....This was our New Year's Eve movie...laughed again...now we can hardly wait to borrow the Red 2 movie from our grandson.
Good action movie, good plot, believable (in this day and age) well acted, good choice of characters, well blended, leaves you wanting more.
This is one of those silly movies that just hits the right note.  The stars are significant (Willis, Morgan Freeman, May Louise Parker, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich).  It is funny and fun.
This movie had a great cast of "A" list actors that played their roles perfectly. They made a great team of retired spies.
After so many years, we have identified the living heroes... and they are in this move.  Great cast for action, some humor, light and pure entertainment.
Very good movie! It picked up where the first one left off. It's a must see! You should order it today!
This is a really good movie with out all the sex and language that seems to be "required" in an action movie.
Really cute movie. I would have liked less Bruce Willis and more of the others, but overall, really like it.

We love this film. An intelligent, funny, sad at times, action flick for adults. It was wonderful to see this amazing cast in a smart story  that shows that a little gray (or bald) doesn't mean senile or stupid .Helen Mirren is one of the most gifted actors of our time and  her  love story is so sweet and yet not a bit sappy  And can't everyone over forty  relate to John Malkovich's "old man my ass"? Please buy your own copy and enjoy it.

We must have missed this movie at the box office.  We saw it on TV and enjoyed it so much we bought a copy of our own to watch again.  This cast seemed to be having as much fun as we were watching it.  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich and the incomparable Helen Mirren as you've never seen her before are all RED (retired, extremely dangerous) agents. Someone doesn't want them around anymore, and that's where the fun (and lots of violence) begins. Mary Louise Parker is the innocent who gets drawn into the middle of it all. This kept our interest and made us smile - it is nonstop thrills, nonstop fun and pure entertainment.  Buy it, pop some popcorn and sit back and enjoy a good time.  Then buy Red2 for their next adventure.
When I finally got to see this movie I was bummed out that I had missed it when it was on the big screen.  A really enjoyable action movie, I can easily watch it again and again.
A thoroughly entertaining movie with the perfect cast. Humor and action. Simply getting out of a car will forever be boring now. Watch. Enjoy.
Great movie with lots of humor. The action scenes along with the great actors are good and keeps your attention.
As Advertised .
My favorite movie..... full of action, and comedy.  Great locations, cool guns, fast cars and superb cast, better than the original :-)
I rented this thinking it would be a balls to the wall action thriller but it just sucked to me.
Watching the house with Christmas decorations shot to pieces in the opening scene is worth the whole movie.  I do not like Bruce Willis but I have to keep reminding myself after this.
I thought it would be good given the talented actors and the fact there was a sequel but I wasted $4 on this one.
Action packed and way to many SUPERSTARS in it...  A fun and fast movie with alot of one liners to entertained.
Better the second time around.  Did not think a sequel could top an original.  So put your order in for Red II, it is even better.

What's not to like about this film?  It's great to see venerable (mostly classic) actors in these unexpected roles.  Well, not unexpected for Bruce Willis.  Anyway, there's loads of humor injected with the action.  Fun twist on senior citizens!

This is a movie to see over and over again!  What fun!  The characters, the plot twists, the humor, and the quirky combination of these folks makes for excellent entertainment.  I highly recommend it!
Again tis was a gift for the same friend and he loved it, I had already seen the movie last month
My husband and I loved this movie. It is very funny and has lots of "blowed up real good" action. Its a very enjoyable escapist film if you like action genre.
I hope the continue this franchise a really unexpectedly funny, funny movie.  I would recommend to highly.  Bruce Willis is really good as is all the other main characters.
Red has become an addiction for me.  If I don't watch it every few days, I have withdrawal symptoms.  The cast is absolutely wonderful, and they have great chemistry with each other.
The batteries are as good as the original Samsung battery!  Shipped was promised via Amazon Prime.  I am very satisfied.
A simple movie to watch, not much to think about but it is also ...  Simply entertaining and fun to watch!
it is an very active movie. a lot of tongue and cheek jokes. it is not a movie that takes its self seriously.
Love this movie and the sequel! The characters were written very well, and the actors were hilarious with their portrayals!
i really enjoyed it. I especially loved the performances by John Malkovich and Helen Muirren. I hope i spelled her name right. Can't wait to rent Red 2.
I love this movie and purchased it for my son in law, now he wants to see Red 2.  It has action and humor two combinations I love.

Really great film, the writing could have been a tad bit better, but the cast made up for it.  Not a big fan of a few of the "moments" in the film, but overall, I had a great time with this one.  Excellent performances, lots of action, would watch again!

Enjoyed it, it was fun.  Bruce Willis is always good IMO.  Morgan Freeman is always good.  The movie was good, actually Red 2 was better which is unusual.  It's funny and exciting and as long as you don't think too much, you'll enjoy it.  One day Hollywood will make an action movie that obeys the laws of physics.  Yeah right, like that would ever happen!

I definitely wish that I had not paid any money for this movie. If it is available streaming for free, AND you are poking your eyes out bored, then it may be better than blindness, but if those variables are not in play, don't bother.
good to see older actors (actress) in action movie and movie moves fast .pretty much a fun movie. ok ok
I love the movie, we got it for my grandpa on Christmas but my siblings and I watch and enjoy it as well.

This was so good that we ordered RED 2 - they both were exciting and held our interest - both humorous and really exciting - good actors.  Highly recommend it.
Celeste Robertson
Great cast, hilarious story line, interesting character development, and a twisty plot with explosions! Good for watching with friends or adult family because there's something for everyone.

WOW! This movie has lots of adventure, comedy and romance all rolled up into one movie ... Enjoyed & would recommend  :)
great movie. very funny and great action flick. this was a surprise hit when it was released and is a great movie for your collection
This is a very entertaining & funny movie that I love seeing it over & over again. It is very well directed & I really like how the actors interacted with each other.
is one of the best movies of bruce willis is funny and full of action i recomended to have a nice movie night

Fans of any of the principal actors will like this movie very much. All are true to form and the story moves quickly, is well written and the interactions between the players are amusing and believable. A fun, exciting ride!

Loved it
Would recommend it to anyone that watches that kind of movies love the stars in it

 Good movie

This is a movie that the viewer can just switch off his or her mind , and just enjoy the film.  The plot is very simple, good guys versus bad guys, although the good guys are on shaky ground.  The cast does a wonderful job of hamming it up.  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirrim, and John Malkovich, just enjoy themselves.  Sure the ending is preposterous, so what, this type of film demands that type of ending, for it to work out.  No one is taking themselves seriously in this film, and that makes it fun to watch, the viewer does not have to look for deep meanings, or redeeming social lessons.  Take my advice, and just enjoy it for what it is, a great put-on.  I recommend it for the smiles and laughs you'll get out of it.  JRV
RED (Retired Extremely Dangerous) was quite funny, fast paced and tender.  We really enjoyed this movie - the acting was excellent.

Bought this for my husband as a gift...he LOVED it!  The guys won't be disappointed, but the girls will like it too.  I enjoyed it almost as much as he did.  Going to get RED 2 next, heard it was better than the first.
Great cast of actors that worked very well together.  Enjoyable story line. A fun time.  I couldn't wait to see the sequel.

This movie was very action packed, yet humorous.  My husband spent one Saturday evening watching it and completely enjoyed it from beginning to end.  Bruce WIllis was a hoot and I would recommend this to mature adults.

Just a great movie funny and with lots of shootm' up movie and of course Bruce Willis as usual shot up and destroied almost everything it was great.

then we found Red 2..........
My grandson will enjoy owning this movie for a long time.  He will treasure this movie for the rest of his life!

The DVD plays great for about 15-20 minutes, then it starts freezing. I finally had to just give up trying to watch it. I bought it for Christmas, and this was the first time to watch it. I am very disappointed in this purchase. I love the movie, but the DVD is junk.
Fun action movie with lots of surprising characters. Fun to watch these older guys you don't get to see much.
excellent concept with one of the best fight scenes I've seen in a long time.  Fun action throughout and good cast

This is different, but on the second watching I was fully involved. I think maybe the cold meds I was taking made the first watch a little faded. LOL
anyway, what a cast and these are actors who can take a fairly predictable plot and take the story to the highest level. had to own it after I had rented it.
Typically fun and dangerous all at once. Won't spoil it by saying too much. A must have if you like off beat action movies.
Good cast.  They work well together.  No wonder there was a second.  Good plot to work with, that helps.  Definitely worth spending an afternoon to watch!

I liked all the characters in this movie they are very interesting. I liked the love story and comedy parts of the movie
My daughter recommended this to us.  She knows what her Mom and Dad like and she was right. Fun and exciting !

I purchased this film because I saw 'Red 2' first, and I am glad I did. This is an incredible film that captivated my interest despite me having a sense of what was going to happen to the main characters, i.e., most of them make it to the sequel. Great action scenes, sensible plot, good dialogue, and characters you grew to care about makes this an enjoyable movie to watch. Glad I own it, which I debated whether to purchase or rent, because I intend to watch it multiple times. This is one of those films where multiple viewing is going to enrich your enjoyment as you discover/make sense of things you missed the first time.
It is enjoyable to see a movie where all the characters are not buffed poster boys. It is funny and clever at the same time.
It's one of those movies where you find yourself chuckling.  Great script & casting.  Earnest Borgnine as the Records Keeper.  Helen Mirren as the sniper.  It's awesome!
All of the actors work extremely well together as a team. timing is great and the pace is energetic. A great tongue-in-cheek look at the world of espionage and "retirement". Very funny.
This is a great movie so I ordered the second one too. Everyone in my family loves it just love that Bruce Willis.
I loved this movie. It was action packed and a comedy rolled all into one. Cant wait to see part 2

LOVED THE MOVIE AND ALL THE ACTORS IN IT.  I WOULD RECOMEND IT TO ALL THE ACTION BUFFS OUT THERE.  THANK YOU VERY MUCH.

whoever thinks it's a great idea to use all the old action heroes in new action movies is somehow pulling it off.  this movie is awesome. bruce willis manages to bring the pain while also looking like he's next to death from old age... just like morgan freeman and the adorable older blonde lady i'm not sure of her name.
anyway... great movie, great plot, great story, great acting.  i usually rent first to see how terrible a movie is... bought this movie the same day i rented it.
It is the same old movie but with the hi-def audio and video, it is more enjoyable to watch again.

Didnt think I'd care for a Bruce Willis movie but this one was great. Love Malcovich. He was his usual "crazy" self. Love Mary Louise Parker and Helen Mirrin. The movie kept on the end of my seat. Looking forward to Red 2

Just as good as the first movie. Love action comedy combo. Bruce Willis is awesome! Clean movie too...apart from the 'killing' but even that it's nicely done.

John Malkovich steals every scene that he is in. There was a big showdown at the end, when the puppet-master was revealed but it ended with a laugh. "Let's go get pancakes".

The movie was ok, I thought it would be a bit funnier.
 I love being able to rent from Amazon though

I have seen this movie in the theatres snd watched it several times on television. I gave this as a Christmas gift to my sister. I recommend anyone who likes Bruce Willis to see this movie. The vendor sent the item in good condition and it arrived it plenty if time for Christmas day.

Great movie!  A fun take on the tired spy genre.  John Malkovich is hilarious and the action is great!  A must watch.
This movie is funny, well written and great action shoots.  We own it and we plan to see it on a regular bases.  The cast is superb and the acting is exceptional.
Pretty sure the comic book would have been better.  Storyline has possibilities but the director et al dropped the ball.  Don't bother watching.

We had seen this movie three times and I decided to give it to my husband along With Red 2 for Christmas.  It was well received!!  Hysterically funny!! Morgan Freeman has a small part & Helen Miren is outstanding as a female hitman or hitwoman. Once you watch it, you're hooked & will insist on ordering Red 2. Lots of fun.

Improbable violence, with a small team of retired operatives taking down the security apparatus of an entire government. With Bruce Willis on your side, anything is possible, right?

Quite enjoyable, and highly recommended.
Great cast.  Everything you could want in an entertaining movie: Action, comedy, fun, entertaining (I already said that)!  Lots of stars you will recognize and appreciate.
Great movie for my 12 year old and us to watch.  It kept his interest through the whole movie.  Looking forward to seeing Red 2.
This one is better than Reds.  Every one is so funny and it works.  I hope they come out with a Reds 3
Excellent deep discount that led to my purchase of RED 2. Nice to see products being placed into discount with a tie in of another product.

I really liked this movie, liked all of the actors - casting was spot on. It's a little bit romantic comedy, a little bit action/adventure, and a little bit conspiracy spy thriller - a little something for everybody. Don't take it too seriously and you'll enjoy it. Be aware that there's lots of violence, but it's light-hearted violence, no blood and guts. It's worth watching!

I had heard about this movie, but wasn't intending on ever buying it.  Amazon had it for such a low price, I knew I wouldn't be disappointed!  Ended up being a DVD we watched with our College boys while home for Christmas, and they enjoyed it!
This movie has it all. A great cast. A fun story line. Great action combined with great humor. There is nothing to not like here.

Bruce Willis and company do not disappoint in this fun, typically-over-the-top Bruce extravaganza. I love that Helen Mirren plays so out of character as a badass sharp shooter. If you like explosions and snarky comments and crazy plots, you'll love this!
Loved this DVD and I ordered to go along with new one in sequel to have and watch whenever I wanted!! Arrived on time and in good condition. Thank-You!

I really enjoyed this movie! It has lots of great action without being gory. I really appreciate that. it has great lines and is funny as well. it didn't download.  and on this site I found nothing that I could do about that.  I'd like to see the movie though.

This movie was great!  This movie should be seen the actors are great and the laughs just keep happening I will watch this movie over and over again.

OK. Not as good as I expected but was worth watching. A little hocky but it was ok. OK OK

4 of the best actors alive in one film, obviously geared around Bruce but he was eclipsed by all 3 of the others. John was at his best, Helen what can you say easily one of the best actors in history and Morgan just loved him in this. The special effects were just about right. Story was fresh and so much fun.

you have to love this movie. I watched this when it first came out but forgot it then I watched it and was so happy that I bought it.

This movie had lots and lots of stupid gun violence, so extreme I think (hope) it was meant to be funny.  Not much blood, mind you, but enough bullets were sprayed to build a battle ship. Red is great popcorn fun that I think you will enjoy.  The movie stars Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Mary-Louise Parker, Karl Urban, and very funny John Malkovich.  The movie is directed by Robert Schwentke, who previously directed The Time Traveler's Wife and Flightplan.  The plot of the movie Frank (Bruce Willis) is retired, bored and lonely living off his government pension in a nondescript suburb in an equally nondescript house. The only joy in Frank's life are his calls to the government pension processing center when he gets to talk to his case worker Sarah (Mary-Louis Parker).  Sarah is as bored and lonely as Frank and marks her conversations with the unknown Frank and her spy novels as the only things fun in her life. When something in Frank's past forces Frank back into his old line of work and puts an unwitting Sarah in the middle of the intrigue, Frank and Sarah begin a journey into Franks past and the people he used to work with. Like Frank they are all RED ... Retired Extremely Dangerous.

I enjoyed this movie and I think you will too.

Thank you for reading my review

This is just a quick review of the commentary. It was given by a former CIA member as he gives his thoughts on his career in the biz as well as helping out on the movie. Some of the scenes are spot on he said as far as authenticity, some make believe. He never bashes the film though. What I liked was that he was pretty forward about CIA techniques, how to pick locks, trail someone, kill someone with a pencil, and how to travel light when on missions. Plus much more insight into the silent career of an agent. If you like commentaries, give it a listen.

You really can't miss on this one for laughter and fun. There have been other films that gather a strong star cast but either a really week story or lack of chemistry doesn't work. This is not the case here . The premise is pretty simple : Someone is starting to take out retired Black Op agents , a reporter , helicopter pilot. You can tell the cast is just having a great time playing out the story .  Bruce Willis still kicks ass but is really just wanting a regular life after retiring 2 years earlier . Mary Ellen Parker is fun as his love interest who loves spy stories and then unwittingly gets caught up with the old gang. Morgan Freeman is as easy going as ever. John Malcovich really shines as a superb former Op who still approaches the world with healthy paranoia. Watch his facial expressions - priceless. Helen Mirren : Classy and no nonsense and her former Russian agent lover re entering her life is fun. They all work well together trying to figure out who's after them and then take care of it. Or as Malcovitch says after one of the multiple attempts on their  lives " old man my ass" . The lead CIA agent refers to Willis as " Grampa" despite Willis out maneuvering him at each turn . Ernest Borgnine and Richard Dreyfuss have small but fun parts. Definitely worth buying .
