Fun fact before I begin.  Brian Cox, who is in this 'Red' I'm reviewing is also in another film entitled 'Red'.  The later 'Red' is about a man whose only friend in the world is killed by some punk kids.  His only friend is his dog.  Afterward things escalate for everyone, and Cox's character finds himself taking justice into his own hands.  I've never seen it, but it did well, (as far as renting goes).  People who rented it seemed to like it.  I plan on watching it sometime in the future.  Anyway...

This CIA infused 'Red' is quite a fun ride.  This was definitely a side project for all the actors involved, but they give it 100 percent, and it shows.  This movie delivers an all star cast involving:  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, the previously mentioned Brian Cox, Richard Dreyfuss, Karl Urban, Mary-Louise Parker and others.

This title came out a few years ago but is still an enjoyable film to watch.

***Movie/Plot Details, Some Spoilers Ahead***

The premise is simple, R.E.D. stands for "Retired, Extremely, Dangerous."  This cast of ex-killers are exactly that.  They may be up in years a little, but their skills are far from rusty.  The film first centers in on Bruce Willis's character, Frank Moses, a former CIA asset who is having a hard time adjusting to normal un-exciting civilian life.  He has no friends, no hobbies, and the only joy he has is ripping up his government paychecks so he has an excuse to call Mary-Louise Parker at the human resources department.  It's sad really.

Well, things heat up rather quick for Frank Moses, he is assaulted in his very own house by a killing squad one night.  After dispatching them all, this is Bruce Willis we're talking about, he goes on the road, kidnaps ...Parker and gets his old band of killing buddies back together to try and figure out why they are all getting marked for death after all these years.

There is an uneasyness between all the cast, every time they come face to face they always ask the same question, "Are you here to kill me?"  They may be formal work mates but they are killers after all, and there can only be so much trust I guess.

Malkovich's character is by far the funniest in the movie.  He's your classic paranoid loner type.  The funny part is, his paranoias are actually true.

Morgan Freeman's screen time is not enough in my opinion, but the little he has is good.  Mirren and Brian Cox round out the team and we the viewers are left with a collection of actors that really work well together and deliver a good movie.

Oh...by the way Karl Urban is in the film.  He's the younger CIA wet work asset who is after Bruce Willis and the others.  Good fight scene between him and Willis.

---To Sum Up---

Great, funny, and action packed film.  I enjoyed it at the movie theater and on DVD numerous times.  It's really going for cheap now, so grab this one up.  Will there be a sequel?  I certainly hope so, this is too good to not jump into again.

Well that's my thoughts on this awesome movie.  Now if you'll excuse me there's someone at my door with a gun...oh it's just Bruce Willis.

I can't say that I am a big fan of any one of the stars in this movie, that is, I didn't buy this movie because Bruce Willis, Helen Mirren, Morgan Freeman, etc, were in it.  But their interaction in this flick is enjoyable and entertaining.  Yes, things get a bit far-fetched at times.  But, overall the movie held my interest and for the price was a bargain.  The person who stole the show  was John Malkovich (Marvin).  Watch the movie and you'll understand what Marvin means when he utters the phrase "I'm getting the pig."
Loved the movie, funny, exciting and kept us on the edge or our seats.  A great flic for an evening of fun.
Absolutely top notch in all aspects.  Great acting and hilarious one-liners throughout make this an absolute top shelf movie.  This is one worthy of watching multiple times!

First of all, take my review here with a grain of salt because Bruce Willis participating in a comedy/adventure is just a disaster/major disappointment waiting to happen.  And so... Red is just that- a waste of my precious time.  I knew this movie was going to be bad when it started- Bruce is calling a woman at work on the phone and for several minutes they talk nonsense about visiting Chili for vacation and other pointless topics.  That kind of writing is beyond pointless- it doesn't belong in ANY movie, let alone this one.  Well it gets worse, MUCH worse.

One night Bruce walks into the kitchen and *in the most melodramatic way imaginable* intruders with guns break in and attempt to take Bruce out.  I just assumed Bruce was imagining this entire incident given the lack of suspense... but no.  He responds by putting bullets in a frying pan and having them explode and shoot across the room in an attempt to trick the crazy gunmen.  I admit I DID like how the men were firing literally hundreds of bullets per second at Bruce's house.  I may dislike the guy in these type of films but I don't necessarily hate him *that* much!

The film then reveals what it is- a really pathetic, exaggerated, generic adventure/shooter.  Bruce kidnaps the woman he was chatting on the phone with, or rather, breaks into her home.  The suspense was killed here the moment the woman hesitated to feel frightened over Bruce's presence.  What?  The way the two of them communicate wasn't the least bit funny and perfectly indicated what kind of silliness and low budget writing this was going to be... for the next hour and 30 minutes.  It just gets worse from there.  Avoid.

I really enjoyed this movie. Watch out you young wippersnappers us old folks are still alive and capable of kicking butt. Theres a lot that could be learned by the younger generations if they'd just get to know and listen to what their grandparents could tell you. All the high teck stuff is wonderful but the old ways are too.

Watch this movie all the way through and it is pretty good. Setting changes up (a real multi-site shoot.) a lot and it is more of a character driven movie. A little over the top but it proves that though you may be aging you can still be cinematically relevant.
Bruce Willis rocks, Great service as usual.

I just ordered this movie last month.  We've watched it at least 3 times.  I have just been reading the other reviews and they have solidified for me something that is so hard to put into words.  This move is a comedy/adventure/romance, and does all three well.  We do not like slap-stick so rarely touch anything with comedy in any way related but this was a fun movie and you had to listen to pick up the good lines.  Anyone just wanting a fun relaxing time will enjoy it.
One of the funniest action movies that I have seen yet. With a phone call all the way to why did this happen to me theme. This movie will leave you wanting more.

I am not a big Bruce Willis fan, but he is great in this movie and the supporting cast are at least as good as Bruce, if not better.  The plot is not complicated, but all the twist and turns will definitely keep your attention.  When I spend money to buy a movie while I can watch it free on HBO free, you know that movie is worth watching.
Red is a fast pace shoot em' up movie. I thoroughly enjoyed it! I thought even though they shot people there wasn't to much gore.

Absolutely funny dark humor and great cast and outstanding acting, I love it and hope they make more movies like this. Action packed with comedy Willis is his normal great cool acting self as well as being supported by an entourage of GREAT actors.

The story itself would be pretty run-of-the-mill ex-spies on the run being hunted down for what they know (yep, basically Bourne series was the latest to mine this) but this movie reaches far beyond its B movie roots because of an excellent cast. Bruce Willis channels his best stoic Die Hard character. The woman from Big (Mary Louise Parker) is plausible as his love interest. Throw in a Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich playing his usual loopy self and Helen St. Mirren as a guntoting sniper, well, have you got a movie or what?

There's even a gratuitous Mermaid Man (Ernest Borgnine of Spongebob voice work fame...I threw that in there for the kids) and Richard Dreyfuss as the baddie.

The whole thing works because of the acting period. Obviously, the actors had a ton of fun doing this and that is confirmed by the 30 minute extra on behind the scenes. Also, the director is a genius. His dissolves to each location by slapping up a postcard be it of New Orleans or New York City and how the camera zooms in to the location within the postcard is way cool.

The extras also rock as there's a great animated CIA conspiracy history, commentary tracks with an ex-CIA operative on there as well as this Red trivia track you can fool around with.

FYI, the movie title does not stand for some Communist plot (although Brian Cox plays an ex-KGB agent) but stands for "Retired Extremely Dangerous."
This movie is very entertaining, even up to the closing credits. It makes you laugh and and root for the "good" bad guys.
Oh, what a wonderful movie!  Truly great entertainment.  The twists and turns in the script make it enjoyable and funny.  Great combination of actors.

Can't say enough about how much our entire family loves watching this movie over and over again. It's hilarious, action packed, has great dialogue and an awesome ensemble cast. But the most interesting thing about the Blu-Ray edition is listening to the ex-CIA agent's commentary about how the movie compares to the real world. There are some juicy tidbits included in there. Last but not least, I was going to say how I love Karl Urban, Bruce Willis and Mary-Louise Parker, but just adore the other main actors, too, so cannot leave out Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Brian Cox, and a wonderful cameo by Ernest Borgnine.
This movie is so fun to watch!  We can watch it over and over again and still enjoy it just as much every time.  We love it!

Who would have thought ten years ago there would be an ensemble action film with Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren, and John Malkovich?  Throw in Brian Cox and Richard Dreyfuss, and that is an absolute murderer's row of acting.  And it's just as good as expected.

The four main stars are RED, Retired Extremely Dangerous, ex-agents who are no longer predators but prey.  Or so the government and its lead agent (Karl Urban) think.  Willis leads the way like it's another installment of Die Hard, bringing along friends who he thought would make the movie-making experience enjoyable.  The professionalism, action, and comedy quickly creates familiarity and there isn't a dull point in the entire film.  To be quite honest, it's plays like the globe-trotting 20th sequel to Ocean's Eleven decades in the future.  Except in this version, Willis plays a better front-man than Clooney and Mirren is absolutely jaw-dropping in her ruthless portrayal as a wet-works expert.  The Freeman-Malkovich combo is collectively hilarious, with Freeman's easy playfulness and Malkovich's insane, paranoia providing a perfect complement to the rather straight-laced Willis spy games.

Great movie from beginning to end, literally every base is covered and enjoyable.  The action (car chases/crashes, guns and rockets, a few throat chops) is thrilling, the attempts at comedy are funny, and the drama is heartfelt and relatable.

I'll just start by saying that this was a fun movie to watch. Better than expected. I saw the previews and thought that it had potential, but I was weary because the reviews were so scattered in their opinions of it. I was still hopeful though, mainly because it had Bruce Willis (always good for a fun show), Morgan Freeman (awesome actor), Helen Mirren (excellent actress in cool roles), and Karl Urban (rising in stardom). Sorry, John Malkovich wasn't in that list because I was never really fond of him, but he did add a lot of comedy to this film. He did a great job in this role. The story is about a group of retired CIA operatives who are suddenly thrown back into the action when they are strangely placed on the RED (retired, extremely dangerous) list and become targets for the police force. Now, don't expect a lot of content when you watch the film. It is, above all else, an action film. It's kinda like Ocean's Eleven meets Live Free or Die Hard. It's got lots of guns, explosions, and ridiculous action. And lots of comedy. Lots and lots of comedy. But it is a man movie, so just enjoy the ride and don't think too hard. I have to admit, I think my favorite part of the film was Mary-Louise Parker. She plays Willis' love interest in the film and she is hilarious. I think she really holds this movie together, aside from the action of course. Oh, and Helen Mirren blowing people away with a gun is pretty-dang funny too. So, an enjoyable film with lots of comic surprises if you're in the mood for a good comedy-action flick. As far as questionable content: Violence. More violence. Lots of violence. (It is an action film after all.) Some extreme cases of violence include a guy getting blown apart by a grenade - not gore, but borderline. There is some profanity as well. A few cases of the "s-h-" word and one strong use of the "f-" word. [...]

I am not a prude, but it is nice to see a movie that doesn't use profanity in every sentence in the script.  Granted, it has violence.  Video games have more and although the body count is high, you don't have blood and body parts everywhere.  No, this movie will not answer any profound questions you might have.  But if you want to see a good movie with Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren and Bruce Willis and a good supporting cast, I don't think you will be disappointed.  The movie is a pleasant diversion and who doesn't need that?
Very happy with this movie I have not yet opened it but I love the movie so I am sure that this one will be great!
I have been thoroughly pleased with the prompt arrival and shape this movie came to me. It is an excellent movie and I look forward to enjoying it for many years to come.
I bought this for my Dad as a Christmas present. He watched it the very next day. He called me and told me how much he loved it!!

this movie may not have sold alot of tickets in the box office, but i love it. movies are out there to entertain, get our minds off things, laugh once in a while. they don't all have to be oscar winners, thats why we have cult classics. i also love the cast, great.

i purchased red before christmas for christmas present but found out it was not going to be delivered till janaury so spoke to advisor online asking if this was correct and they confirmed yes so when i said it would be to late they knocked 50 pecent off which was good and i also received it before christmas afterwards which was good .i give it to my nephew for christmas and then i found out it was the wrong region and would not play in uk ,so i was not happy the advisor i spoke to did not make this clear to me ,they of just mentioned it seeing that it was going to uk address

What a great movie this is!  I just got done viewing this for the first time and from the first scene to the last it is great!  An all-star cast makes this a pleasure to see.  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Dame Helen Mirren, John Malkovich, Mary-Louise Parker and other brilliant actors make this movie interesting and captivating from beginning to end.  The "Red" Squad are retired CIA Agents and Assassins with a mix of old KGB and MI-6.  These "Cold War" warriors are definitely the people you don't want to mess with!  This movie is intelligent with the plot and it doesn't take itself too seriously and is great fun.  Many laugh-out loud scenes and you can tell all the actors/actressess had alot of fun making this movie.  Why are is the CIA out to get these retired agents?  Well, I won't spoil the movie for you.  Let's just say that when you get older you definitely get "better"!  Moldova Sucks!  Highly Recommended!
Really enjoyed this movie, so bought it. Item was at a good price and being a Special Edition made it that much better. Thanks.
I bought the bluray because I liked the movie.  It's pretty cheesy and some of the stuff is unbelievable but I like the storyline and it was entertaining overall.
The movie was good... I mean great in so many ways. wow, the visuals and stunts as always were amazing. Acting was great and i have to watch it again if i want to go for action movie.

R.E.D. (Retired and Extremely Dangerous) stars Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren and John Malkovitch. It is clever, at times brutal but often quite funny. The listed actors are joined by other very fine actors who  deliver fine performances, in both the comic parts as well as the more serious moments.  The idea is that these former C.I.A. agents must be eliminated for reasons that must remain obscure  (they have to figure it out for themselves, then they'll tell you).  It delivers quite a few laughs, and not a little suspense along the way. Well done!

I have to admit that I had already seen this film at the cinema before I bought it.  Matter of fact,that's why I bought it.

The combination of Willis, Mirren and Malkovich was brilliant casting - especially Mirren.  She makes a lovely assassin.

The movie is about a group of 'retired' spies who are drawn back into a job, and they carry it off with humor, expertise and aplomb.

If you enjoy danger and humor and a sort-of love story  - this is the movie for you.

Well I guess if you're going to throw a bunch of older actors into an action film, this is the cast.  Forget about "The Expendables" and "The A Team", this is the one for the AARP set.  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich play retired spies who are under fire because they were involved in the extraction of a young agent who went off the grid so to speak when he wiped out a village in South America.  It turns out he is now the Vice President and a tool for a rich arms dealer and financier.  But forget about the plot, this comic book film adaptation is enjoyable to say the least.  As you might expect there are plenty of plot holes and unnecessary "booms" but for the most part it works.
My wife and I both enjoyed this movie.  A lot of fun.  I expected it would be (just) some decent light entertainment.  It's actually better than that.

The special edition is clearly labeled as for sale only in Canada, but no mention of this is made in the listing.  I was able to make it through one of the previews, before the movie froze up, & would not advance.  Several other reviews mention the same problem (freezing up) so if you really want this movie in a hard copy, try buying one from a brick & mortar store.
GREATMOVIE SAW IT WHILE TRAVELING ON r/r FROM IRAQ TO ECUADOR ENJOYED IT AND DECIDED TO PURCHASE IT.I would recommend it to all my friends.

Bruce Willis has a knack for picking (or being picked for) quirky action comedies. This certainly fits in that category.

The movie is great, and the DVD's good. Video encoding was high quality (I got the DVD version, not blu-ray) and no problems watching it on my PC.

One of my favorite recent movies!

Great movie! Great Service!  Would do business again with this company again.  The movie arrived on the date that I was told.  It actually got here before some of the stuff I ordered on the same day.  I was thoroughly pleased.

Like action comedies with a great cast? This is it! I'm a fan of everyone in the cast, (they even included Ernest Borgnine!) and it makes the movie that much more enjoyable. Watched it for the second time, will be watching it several more. A fun ride!
This was one of the best comedies I've seen in a while.  Absolutely loved Malkovich's character.  I highly recommend this all-star cast.

BRU

Bruce Willis shows that he still is the current champion of action movies. Interesting, Exciting and fun  action movies are hard to come by. Watch this one and it will become one of your favorites.
HUBBY & I ENJOY WATCHING THIS MOVIE. IT HAS LOTS OF ACTION, FUN & GOOD ACTORS. WE LOVE IT WHEN THE GOOD GUYS SHOW THE BAD GUYS WHAT'S WHAT!

I have to be honest, I didn't really know what to expect from this movie and what I got was a fantastically good time!

This was just too much fun!  RED stands for Retired and Extremely Dangerous and that is borne out as you watch the action unfurl in this deliciously dark and funny comedy.

Frank, played by Bruce Willis, doesn't really like retirement all that much.  It's kinda boring after the life he'd led while working for the CIA.  The only thing he really enjoys is talking to his case worker at the Social Security office who takes care of his 'missing' social security checks which he has conveniently torn up so that he has a reason to call her.  They connect in a way he's never connected with women in a face to face situation and so they flirt and tease, giving Frank something to cling to.

And then something really strange happens one night.  A wet work team all in black shows up and shoots up his house with Frank in it.  Realizing that something's up, he hits the road to find out why someone is coming after him now that he's living a life of retired obscurity and has to kidnap his Social Security crush because she's in danger, too.

He starts looking up his old buddies from the old days, also retired now into quiet obscurity, but retired doesn't mean dead and they are all soon working together to figure out what happened to put Frank on the hot list with a bullet and then to put a stop to the plot behind the plot.

And all the while this is going on, the girl who had been harboring her own crush on Frank and looked forward to his calls to complain about another missing check finds herself having a fantastic adventure that beats anything in the pulp romance novels that she shared with Frank.

This was a truly fun and funny film with a great deal of plot twists and action to satisfy every movie tastebud in the family.

And, quite frankly, any movie where Richard Dreyfus is the bad guy has something going for it!

Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren and John Malkovich round out this cast and it is Malkovich's portrayal of a slightly off the rails former agent who lives off grid and underground that adds the most hilarity to the movie.

When the going gets tough, the tough get the pig!

Well, THAT was the most fun I've had in a movie in a long, long time! This thing is intricately plotted, perfectly photographed, and extremely well cast! Although there was little or no profanity and no sweaty bodies, we did see a lot of gunfire, car chases and blowie uppie stuff. The audience ate it up!

First, let's talk about that cast:
*  Bruce Willis ("Cop Out") is a former CIA black-ops agent, now he's Retired, Extremely Dangerous...get it? He's trying to deal with boredom and inertia, and has taken to calling a particular gal in a call center about a check he keeps insisting never arrived.
*  Mary-Louise Parker ("Weeds") is that gal (see above). She reads bodice-rippers like Love's Savage Fury and dreams of having a manly man come into her life and sweep her away to excitement, passion and exotic locales. She is hilarious!
*  Morgan Freeman ("Invictus") is another retired agent, now relegated to a nursing home where he is dealing with a terminal illness. He too, is bored and lonely; this is NOT the way he expected his life to end.
*  John Malkovich ("Secretariat") is also part of this bunch. He spent a few years being injected with LSD, so his hold on reality is a bit shaky, but he LOVES guns, ammo and explosives! Talk about a loose cannon!
*  Helen Mirren ("The Last Station") isn't quite as retired as her buddies; she admits she still "takes a side job or two." She can wield a machine gun with the best of them and still packs a yen for an agent she had to shoot.
*  Ernest Borgnine ("SpongeBob SquarePants") should have retired years ago, but he's still working in the CIA's top-top-secret archives.
*  Richard Dreyfuss ("My Life in Ruins") is an industrialist who knows WHY a mysterious list was made of people who MUST die.
*  Karl Urban ("Star Trek") is absolutely perfect as a new-generation black-ops agent, every bit as well trained and deadly as his predecessors. I'm always impressed by him.

This terrific film was beautifully directed by Robert Schwentke ("The Time Travelers's Wife") and I could hardly wait to get my DVD from Amazon.com. When every scene is deliciously shot, with guts, glamor and LOTS of giggles, we naturally look to the director. Let's keep an eye out for this guy, okay?

Great acting performance by Helen Mirren, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, and probably one of Bruce Willis' finest performances. The arrived as described within a a reasonable amount of time that was promised. Great purchase.

I purchased this dvd months ago, just got arpond o watching it last night, the first 20 min. of the dvd was flawed so bad I could not watch it! Why is it when we purchace something "new" from amazon, we get used  quality merchandise??? Too late to return, but from now on, I will watch my dvd's sooner!!!!

I think this movie is fun and get aditional cool because I think this is a frech and new plot that hasn`t been done like this befor.

I saw it in the theaters a couple of times but that's been months so I wanted a refresher.  It's one of those movies where you can tell that the actors and actresses involved had a great bit of fun making the movie.

I love all the actors in this movie.  It was a lot of fun to watch.  You've got everything: comedy, romance, action and a fun story line.  I highly recommend it.  To top it off, it's one I can watch with my kids, because there is no nudity in it.  I love that!

This was one of those films that you watch after a hard day at work. If you are looking for realism, films and nearly all television is the wrong place to look. If you are looking to relax, be entertained, and have a few laughs this is a great choice!

My favorite part of this film is Helen Mirren. Seeing such an elegant and accomplished actress saying 'I kill people daaaling', and soon after in snow fatigues carrying and shooting a sniper rifle (correctly).... and later firing a heavy weapon in a enclosed place (and in an evening dress), is worth buying the DVD!

The only reason I didn't use FIVE stars is because there are a few (very few) parts that were too far fetched, even for this kind of film.... example Bruce Willis calmly stepping out of a car spinning out of control.... I HATE CGI car stunts!

I bought it when it was more expensive, and it was worth it.... now it is a steal!

This movie is one of our favorites.  It involves action with comedy and some of our favorite actors.

This movie is worth every penny I had to pay for it and I hope it did well at the box office because I wouldn't mind seeing some kind of sequel.
The movie arrived quickly and just as described. This was a very smooth transaction. There were no problems at all. Thanks
I love this movie. The theme is funny and it is well written. The plot was not ordinary. Glad to have seen it.

We have been so pleased with this film.  Willis, Mirren, Morgan, and Malcovich truly deliver a great piece of entertainment.  Granted there are a few cliches seeded throughout the storyline, but this is definitely an amusing movie to watch on those rainy or lazy days.

The beauty of this film is watching these actors of a certain age working together and showing their younger compadres that  old school methods outshine their CGI antics anyday.  "RED" isn't classic stuff.  It's script is a servicable one about an attempt to "retire" Bruce Willis' character by any means necessary.  The weaponry is pretty cool and things blow up real good.  The real pleasure is watching Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, and Brian Cox riff off each other and have a good time doing it.  I wouldn't call "RED" mindless, not with these pros involved, but you can park your brain for a couple hours and have a good time.
This is a true Willis movie. Infinite ammo cheat, he gets to beat people up and be catty, and he gets the girl. Because, really? He's BRUCE WILLIS.

Some of the funninest action comedy I have ever seen.  That old lady who was retired mi6 was pure genius, and  nobody would ever think of her as deadly. What about that character chasing Willis all over the block????
The hand to hand combat was something I'd never expectin his own office - and I laughed so hard I almost had a stroke. :P.  Freeman's only funny scene was at the retirement home with the silencer move. They did not use him that good.  But he was still funny!  Malchovich was a riot.  He never disappoints.  I thought the crazy bunker camoflauge scene thing was just awesome!!  I hope they drop the prices this I'm sure to buy. I'll wait for $9.99.
I don't usually like action type movies, but, bought this one because a friend is in it........really enjoyed it!  This is a fun romp! movie.......
This movie is very entertaining and has a great story attached.  "RED" has lots of action, comedy and  held my attention from start to finish.  Love the actors, they were cast perfectly.
I was happy with this transaction. I ordered it for my dad for Father's Day. It arrived before I ever expected it to, and my dad was very happy with the movie.

This was a super movie! A great combination of action with just enough comedy thrown in to lighten the mood at the perfect times. Always love anything Bruce Willis is in, but this movie was almost stolen by the rest of the leading cast members. Great plot, even one of the bad guys gets some cheers. Enough twists and turns to hold the viewers interest throughout. Highly recommended entertainment.

When retired CIA agents become the target of assassination attempts, they fight back. This action comedy proves that some things do get better with age.

The old black ops team of Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren, and John Malkovich is joined by newcomer Mary-Louise Parker. Together they must elude top level assassins and discover who's trying to kill them and why.

I especially enjoyed seeing a different side of Helen Mirren and Morgan Freeman.

The movie opening will certainly set the WILD RIDE of near boredom scenes preceding WILD ACTION and humor that will knock your socks off !! John Malcovic may not be the big character , but will leave you in stitches !!
  yep , alot seems cornball and is part of the appeal . Bruce Willis sells the action still and gives a minimalist style personality to great action . when Debb has a bad day at work , she wants humor a EXPLOSIONS ; it work to cheer her heart .
  ENJOY !! and don't forget the pop KETTLEKORN

RED was a pretty good movie. My husband likes Bruce Willis, so I picked this one up for him to watch. Besides Bruce Willis, there are a few other great stars who made this a fun, action packed movie. It's a PG13, so really, not much in the way of bad language. Make some popcorn and enjoy Bruce Willis in RED, my husband and I did!

i loved this movie saw it at the cinema then bought it first chance i got. had plenty of action and comedy not a dull moment.some of the best actors in the buisness, my favourit was malkovitch aways plays a good role. if you like good actors in movies you will love this.ross
Lots of fun. Great cast. If you are not in region A (US) do not buy this movie in Blu Ray as it will not play elsewhere (unlike DVDs)!
This is a great movie and a bit of fun. As some of the other reviewers have said, don't take it to seriously and you'll love it. I didn't see a bad performance in it, great cast.
I'm done buying blu rays. The restrictions on the digital copies aren't worth the better picture that I don't notice anyways. Awesome movie though.

All the actors in this were likeable and entertaining, enjoyable to be around. The story is pedestrian, and suffers from the idea that it is clever, creative, and a load of fun. After too many facile escapes the story loses it's credibility. Morgan Freeman, OK, she shoots him causing a distraction. But then show the hoard of FBI agents pursuing the good guy escapees. Then a close-up of the now forgotten Morgan Freeman's face. An eye pops open, rolling back and forth, and seeing nobody around. He gets up. knocks on his bullet-proof vest (gotten from Richard Dreyfuss's hidden room armory)...and  walks away. His death didn't belong in this lighthearted story, and he could have been greatly employed in later scenes. The idea of retired agents kicking butt, intriguing, but needs a more worthy story.

I am so thankful that we consumers have more than one way to watch a movie like this what a dog

RED is a 1 time view at best poor acting, poor plots, goofy lines, I am afaid it only gets 2 stars or D and I am being  kind at that and the movie makers can do better than this and until they do I will save my hard money for a truly excellent one.

You think for 15 bucks they would at least give you high def download from amazon instant video. However the movie is good. Good acting and all around hilarious (think cute grandma with a gauntlet gun).

That made the lines fall flat and turned this movie into a complete dud for me. The secondary characters (Helen Mirren in particular) were great, but it wasn't enough to carry the movie.

The story has a few unique twists and turns that keep the plot moving and interesting. Lots of action (which Bruce Willis is spectacular at IMO) and plenty of humor with some drama mixed in for good measure. Malkovitch plays an excellent nut job, and Morgan Freeman and Helen Mirren are outstanding as always. I have to say - I prefer Karl Urban as a good guy but he does a good job as an agent doing his job even while you don't like him very much for it. I like him more as Bones in Star Trek but not because he isn't good here - he is. Just a personal preference.

All in all a film I will watch and enjoy repeatedly.

Boy can I relate to her, evening gown and a .50 cal no better way to spend an evening!  I am so hoping there will be a sequel  to this one.

This movie turned out SO much better then I expected.  It's a typical action flick, with old actors.  Some WAY past their prime.  But, well done, and well played.  A few corny scenes, and a few over the top scenes, but well done by the director.  And whoever thought of over-the-hill action stars against youngsters, was brilliant.  I enjoyed this movie very much, as did my fiance.  He didn't hold his breath that it would be any good, and he was very surprised also.  I usually don't like John Malkavich, but would watch this movie with him in it again.  He plays a paranoid crazy guy VERY well, which he has prooved over and over.  And, I would have never pegged Helen Mirrin as a mean Momma!  She kicks butt with her scoped rifle and everything.  And both Morgan Freeman and Bruce Willis have prooved that age doesnt necessarily mean only father, grandfather, and president roles.  It was wonderful throwing in Mary-Louis Parker as a love interest that gets pulled into a strange life.

I would recommend this movie to anyone who likes action flicks with a bit of comedy.  If you liked the Die Hards and The Last Boyscout type movies, you will like this one.

The main cast of characters are a bunch of Old Farts like myself. Their having fun in a movie that has it's share of good scenes, as well as improbable events, was certainly an entertaining way to pass an evening as compred to some nights when there is ABSOLUTLEY nothing on TV worth using up electricity;

74 year Old Fart from Southington,Ohio

John Malkovich - no surprise - steals the show with his wacked-out, paranoid character "Marvin Boggs." Like Johnny Depp, Malkovich is very good at playing strange-but-always-interesting characters.
Funny action flick of a group of spies coming out of retirement to help one of their own. "They get the band back together." Mild violence and some crude language.

I Love, Love this movie so we purchased it. Great cast and all bringing in A+ performances. The script was well written and made more interesting by adding back stories along the way for the Agents. Very well done movie although very heavy with all the sometimes too much action and shooting overkill. But despite that I felt this movie had more depth than I expected to the storyline which was a very nice surprise. Love the laughs along the way and the mood of the movie was just good fun. Loved seeing the "older" Characters showing they still had what it took to do the job and then some in the movie. Very clever script. This is a keeper.
it made a long long time that I haven't looked at such a good action movie. the kind of movie you can watch 10 times in a row and still enjoy it ... buy it.

It has everything that makes a movie well done and fun. We have an excellent cast, excellent writing, and excellent plot, and fresh exciting action scenes. Lots of wonderful bangs and booms, yet we like the characters and easily get into the story. I laughed myself silly throughout. I will most definitely be buying this movie very soon.

Scenes like: when Bruce meeting with the Russian man, ex-CIA agents in-love, are totally epic! One kind of a movie. You definitely have to get that movie and watch.

"Red" is a great movie, with people who know what "acting" means.  Keeps you laughing, builds suspense, and of course, a happy ending for the "lovers". The bad guys get what's coming to them, and true love perserveres.  REALLY glad I bought this one from Amazon.

This only applies to the Movie-Only version of Blu-ray. Though it appears quite cheap for this good movie, but it contains only Dolby-Digital soundtrack, and the DTS-HD soundtrack has been taken out, simply cheating !!!
I really enjoyed seeing this movie at the theater.  It was a lot of fun.  It was nice seeing some of my favorite actors make a great movie.

Violence and explosions are not my thing.  That said, this movie has both and it is one the funniest movies I have seen in a while.  Definitely a good choice for the action lover who also has a sense of humor.

Could have been good as the script was reasonable. The Director couldn't seem to make up his mind if it should be a comedy or a thriller and ended up being neither. Bruce Willis needs a hit movie soon or his star will be waning.
Seller provided flawless service and delivery, and the movie "RED" was very entertaining and action filled. One of Bruce Willis' better, recent movies.

Great Movie, Great Cast!  They pulled it off big time.  First movie I've seen in a long time that didn't make me feel like I was getting ripped off!  Kind of cheeky, but that's the beauty of this film.  The good guys pulled it off without the feeling that you had seen this movie adapted from hundreds of the same ideas rolled over and over.  You can't help but smile!

This movie is corny, I'll get that out there, but at the same time it's fun to watch, seeing some of the older Hollywood actors and actresses come out to play in a corny-espionage type flick is just a fun time. Anyone who likes Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, or Hellen Mirren will love this movie.

Fun movie to watch with the kids! my kids like action movies but most are not sutable for them. we all loved this movie and even the 8 year old was laughting and loving the action!! (we screen movies before our kids watch them)
I found this to be light, often delightful, a pleasant romp. If you scratch the surface there is a little more about what spying takes out of you...as per the norm Dreyfuss and Freeman were superb.

Was looking forward to this, given the talented cast and reviews I had read.  What a disappointment! So much potential, but this was just silly, cliche and extremely predictable.  Looked like they had fun making this movie...glad somebody did.

Have you ever seen a movie and then the next day had to remind yourself what you saw? That's "Red." While watching it, it's fun and the John Malkovich made me laugh. I also liked Helen Mirren and Bruce Willis had that charm he has in about one out of every four or five movies. But the plot is thin. Though there are moments of style, they are few and far between. Then it ends in a predictable fashion and the credits roll. I was entertained but hope that Willis does "Expendables 2."

I'm a fan of mindless action films, provided of course that they make some little amount of sense. This one does. I like Bruce Willis films and this one fits right in. Lots of action, good, if somewhat iffy, romantic angle, and Helen Mirren with large caliber guns is a hoot. Not a chick flick.  I liked it enough to buy the disc, even though I had already rented it.

Esta pelcula es de lo peor que he podido ver, unas estrellas de accin como Bruce Willis y Morgan Freeman en semejante petardo. Inconcebible!
This is a poor movie ever see!!!!!

I will keep this short. I bought the $12.99 Red Bluray mistakingly thinking that it would contain the DTS HDMA 5.1 audio track. But no, instead it has a Dolby Digital 5.1 compressed mix which falls well and truly below the audio mix on the 'collectors edition'. It is criminal to release a Bluray with a down sampled audio mix. So I started watching this movie feeling angry which probably did not help my initial impression. Overall, I thought it was a reasonable fun outing but nothing more than poking fun at the real action movies of the 80s. However, it is always great to see the ever likeable John Malkovich on the screen and I thought Helen Mirren did a wonderful job as the gun wielding lady.

All in all 1/5 for releasing a bluray with a dirty old dolby digital track and 3/5 for the film.

totally entertaining movie. my husband pointed out there are a few things that don't make sense in the movie, but who cares. I got this from the library and didn't have much expectation and it turned out to be very good for my standard. great cast.

I watched this movie over the weekend and I have to say that I am a fan of RED. I loved all the action and the actors. There were so many great parts that I kept rewinding the DVD to see them again. I loved the scene where Bruce Willis' character gets out of the police car (I won't spoil it for you). I will be adding this movie to my collection.

This review may never be read, but I had to get in my 5-stars. I haven't had so much fun in years; Willis never fails to entertain, and to gather all these terrific old pros in one place is overwhelming. There isn't a weak link in the bunch, and a terrific script, and excellent direction from Robert Schwentke puts this near the top of my favorite movies of 2010. Quite simply, one of the most enjoyable, entertaining, suspenseful and impressive film-making endeavors I've seen in a long time. I thought, to this point, that "True Lies" was the most fun intrigue/action/comedy movie. This tops it, if only for the magnificent cast and unending craziness. The chemistry among all is perfect. Watching Helen Mirren kick butt is best of all. I repeat: NO END OF FUN! Great editing, photography, lots of 'splosions 'n stuff. Very little foul language, and should appeal to most kids, despite the mindless violence (they can see that on TV anyway, a lot worse). The DVD I watched had no extras. Bummer.

There is no end to the life of an agent of the shop, even those to whom retirement has become the new mode.  Enter the bad guys and now we are off on a merry chase to discover why suddenly, these past specials are now on the terminate list.  It is an interesting romp with just one bump in the road.  Good movie.

I Love Action and I Love Comedy and to have a film that is both Action and Comedy is even better ! And this movie didn't fail to deliver on either the action or the Comedy (though there was more action than comedy).

Frank (Bruce Willies) is a retired secret agent, he just met this girl Sara through the phone and he's living happily. However, things quickly change when a group of assassinates attack his house at midnight in order to get him killed. Now Frank Have No Idea who wants him dead, he's no longer working and won't make a threat to anybody but obviously someone wants him killed. When investigating further Frank discovers that the killers are not only targeting him, there's a list of names (with his name included) and almost everyone on that list is either killed or is going to get killed and the funny thing is almost every one of them is retired and old. Who wants them dead ? And most importantly why ? After searching further Frank discovered that all the names on that list had something in common they all were...well I'm not gonna tell you. You have to watch the film and find out for yourself !

I liked the shooting scene in the cargo, it was funny ! I also liked the scene at the end it was pretty cool. The acting was great ! I love almost all of the actors in this film. I really liked Helen Mirren she was fantastic as always ! My only Complaint is that Morgan Freeman never had enough screen time. The love stories were sweet too, especially the old couple :) and some of the jokes were actually funny even though I'm a person who laughs at actions more than words.

So if you want to see a group of retired secret agents who can still kick some a$$ in a non-corny way then I recommend you watch this, true some of the action is over the top and unbelievable but it was intended to be funny.

My husband and I laughed so hard during this movie that our sides hurt. It was great - the actors were funny and adorable but really good. Our son & his family came to visit and we played it for him and he, his wife and their sons really loved it. It has to be one of the best comedies I've seen in a long time.

I recommend this movie and it is worth watching again.

Received quickly and in great condition.  Love this movie, we like alot of Bruce Willis movies and this was not a disappointment.  Although, we found that John Malkovich and his character was our absolute favorite.  We've already watched this movie a couple of times and we still love it and still laugh at the same parts. I saw this movie in the movie theater and had to have a copy.  I will watch it with some friends who haven't seen it.  I normally do not see movies with lots of violence, but really enjoyed this very clever movie.  Lots of twists and turns to make it interesting.
Saw this movie six times at the movie theater and couldn't wait to purchase it. Everybody is great in the film.

awesome flick. highly suggested to buy to own. never can get bored when watching this!!!

I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this movie... imo Bruce's best since Pulp Fiction.  What starts off slow becomes an action-packed thriller, stylish and fast-paced high octane movie well worth watching.

Red (Movie-Only Edition) [Blu-ray] First: this movie is just plain fun, an action confection which coasts comfortably on the charisma of its familiar stars. I contend that anyone who judges it really harshly is being way too serious. And I was perfectly happy to buy a reduced-price movie-only Blu-ray release. The DVD extras are only rarely something I'm actually interested in. I just wanted a good-quality transfer of the feature at a reasonable price. That's where things went wrong. The video transfer was... perfectly okay. But I didn't believe my eyes (and ears, once the movie started): this Blu-ray includes only nasty, muffled old low-bitrate lossy Dolby Digital audio tracks. You know, the kind you thought were a thing of the past once you switched to a format with the bandwidth of Blu-ray. That's just completely cheesy and unacceptable. This film would've been far more engaging if the sound transfer had been up to snuff.

Red has an all-star cast that includes Bruce Willis, Hellen Mirren, and Morgan Freeman, and was well received, so I expected better than what I got. What I got was just an average film with not enough action or comedy, and I thought this was supposed to be an action-comedy.

If you like movies with over the top action and fast action then this is your movie!  I like the whole retired assassins brought back to help in the "New threat!"  The actor are all incredible and the humor is always well placed!  Buy!  Or at least Rent!

the movie js slow paced and rather sloppy  being that they are trained killers there are no real emotions. good thriller killer movies still find a way to weave emotions into the story. i suggest knight and day instead.

Finally we have a star-packed movie that lives up to the billing. Bruce Willis is in excellent form in both the action and the comedy aspects of his character. Morgan Freeman gives his usual, excellent performance. Mary Louise Parker plays a character that, I thought, was much younger than the actress...and pulls it off without a hitch. John Malkovich is as creepy, funny, and far-out as ever. Dame Helen Mirren is, at one point, wearing an evening gown, combat boots, and firing a 50-caliber machine gun; how can a movie get any better than that!

The romantic story line shows a lot of chemistry between Willis and Parker; I hope they get to work together again because there is definitely a good on-screen harmony between them. The characters seem like a group of old friend who'd been apart for a while. The action is driven by a story that stays consistent and doesn't rely on miracles to bring everything together.

The action, suspense, and comedy is non-stop. The plot actually makes sense and I can imagine a lot of old soldiers sitting around looking at certain developments and saying, "Yep, that's what I would have done there too." :-)

If you are a fan of action or romantic comedy (trust me, my wife liked this movie as much as I did) you'll love R.E.D.

I have always enjoyed Bruce Willis' smart aleck persona, and this movie, "Red" shows Bruce at his best. As a retired member of a CIA black ops team, he obviously has deadly skills, but when it comes to dealing with dating, he's as shy as a little kid.
  The other retired characters are played with marvelous abandon by John Malkovich,as a skillful but very paranoid ex-op. Morgan Freeman is a not quite helpless nursing home resident. Helen Mirren is an elegant Martha Stewart wanna-be with a penchant for taking on the occasional "hit" out of sheer boredom. Brian Cox, an ex Russian spy called on to help the team, is charming as a man with more romance than mayhem on his mind.
  The acting skills of the two other main characters aren't overwhelmed by the blatant over the top acting of the above group. Mary-Louise Parker holds her own and more as the romance novel buff whose dull life and job are interrupted when she finally meets Frank (Bruce). Karl Urban is the unlucky CIA agent who has to "deal" with that over the hill bunch. He does a great job walking a fine line, in that he doesn't come off as a bad guy.
  Richard Dreyfuss in an almost cameo role is as smarmy as you can get playing a very weaselly bad guy. Last but not least; Ernest Borgnine plays the keeper of the secrets, both edited and unedited.
  This movie is sheer adventure with a lot of laughter thrown in. The one liners fly so often that the movie really needs to be seen more than once to catch them all. Sometimes just the expressions on Malkovich's face are enough to crack you up. Suffice it to say that these people aren't your normal Social Security pensioners.
bruce willis does it again, works out great with the entire cast, especially with john malkovich. i have never seen the comic myself, but the movie rocked. who says talent squanders with age?
Good movie - just because of the great actors.  Not as great an action movie as I expected, but it was worth the money.

This was a fun popcorn movie. I enjoyed the action and I normally hate Mary-Louise Parker. Her acting is almost as bad as Sandra Bullock. But she had decent chemistry with Willis. The plot is simply bad but the actors is what makes this film. It really is a joy to watch all these old time favorite actors work with each other. I recommend for an action movie junkie or someone that enjoys watching a collection of good actors working together. Enjoy! oh and MOLDOVA SUCKS!
Do not buy this movie.  Putting out a Blu-ray version without an HD audio track, or even Dolby Plus, is just a cheap money grab.

Who would make a Blu Ray with no HD sound? - Summit would! I did not read the small print and bought the Movie Only Edition $7 cheaper, now I know why. If you only have an SD Sound system (Dolby Digital etc )it is fine.
Audiophile beware!!
latest in the line of Bruce Willis action movies. this is the best of the series, because it uses retired cia operators as the main characters. excellent combination of humor and drama.

Morgan Freeman - one of our great actors of the last four decades, regret he was killed off did an excellent portrayal as an ailing former spook.
Mary Lou Parker - did a good job as BW love interest.

This was an interesting plot and shows possible convoluted actions of the spooks in the U.S. Government and possible lack of communications among the "intelligence" community.
I found the actions of the J. Malkovich character very,very entertaining and Dame Merrin is one of my favorite actors-her role as a killer was fascinating for me.
Morgan Freeman was his usual smooth self and regret his character seemed to have been terminated.
Bruce Willis has been a favorite since Moonlighting, and his roll in this movie was great as a Retired & Extremely Dangerous former Special Ops.member.

I don't usually buy comedies, but after seeing this movie via Netflix, I bought it, and am glad I did.  If you are looking for realism, this movie is not for you, but if you are looking to enjoy an action-comedy where the actors are obviously having a good time, go no further.  This is it.

Others have described the plot and characters, I'll simply say, that I found myself caring about the characters!

I almost gave this just 4 stars, but second-guessed myself and went ahead and gave it 5 stars. RED, is without question, a repeat viewing, non-stop, always interesting, entertainment spectacle. The writing is exactly what you would expect from a cast of Bruce Willis, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Morgan Freeman, Mary-Louise Parker, Rebecca Pidgeon and Richard Dreyfus. It's funny. It's exciting.

This is the kind of movie that people beg for everytime they put their money on the table for the movie business to take. People don't want to be disappointed. They don't want to be bored and they want to finish the movie and still be thinking and talking about it. With RED, you get just that.

From the opening scenes of Frank Moses (Bruce Willis) reading romance novels and trying to live a normal life, making excuses to talk to an operator at the Government Pension office, despite never having met her, and into the moment where his house is flooded by black ops, you get exactly what RED is about. Fun and Action.

Where most movies these days disappoint or bore, RED doesn't do that. It does exactly what you would expect from a movie that puts Bruce Willis where he's most comfortable. It's an action movie that doesn't insult our intelligence. Sure there are some over-the-top things that happen, but most are pheasible or perfectly in place for the movie at hand.

RED is a must own because this is what entertainment is all about.

This is one great flick! An ensemble cast in no particular order, Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren, Mary Louise Parker, John Malkovich, Brian Cox, Richard Dreyfuss, Ernest Borgnine! Yes, you did not misread, Ernest Borgnine! Many would remember him from The Wild Bunch, The Dirty Dozen or Airwolf, just to name a few. Bruce plays a C.I.A. retiree named Frank Moses who becomes enamored with Sarah , a young lady who works for the Pension Department. Over the years of retirement, Frank still tries to keep in shape & keep his senses sharp as ever. For good reason, he is on a hitlist which is being carried out by his former employer, the C.I.A.!!!!
A mission from 1981 comes back to haunt Frank & everyone involved in a greater conspiracy that could see the Vice President make a successful bid for the election of becoming the next President.
After he dispatches the hit team with devastating results, he meets Sarah & takes her with all around the country, meeting up with allies & trying to get to the bottom of this conspiracy.
The mayhem, chaos & fun continues right until the end! This movie never lets up! They maybe retired but they are still the best at what they do! Based on the comic book of the same name, it's just great to see all these actors & actresses have lots of fun doing what they do best!
Highly recommended!

Check.  Funny?  Check (see John Malkovich in first sentence)  Moments of poetry?  Check (see Morgan Freeman in first sentence).
Oh wait.. there's that "Die Hard" dude too... what's his name?  Oh yeah, Bruce Willis.  Even though the film centers on Bruce's character, the support cast is so perfect in this film that you could have cast Homer Simpson as the lead and it would have been a good movie.
A worthwhile edition to any action/comedy junkie's collection.  For the rest... worth seeing at least once... say the digital version?

What a fun movie. We enjoyed this in the theatre and just had to own it. It is a lot of fun. Very entertaining. "Can I kill her now?" The Mythbusters would have fun with a number of the scenes in here, but that is what makes the movies so much fun.

This movie was not exactly what I was expecting. Sure I figured action adventure which it certainly is but it has a lot of humor in it. Though not Oscar material it is a great way to spend a couple of hours. Where it is and it isn't exactly what you thought it would be it certainly doesn't hurt the movie at all. The big surprise is that the cell is all older actors and an actress not what one usually sees in youth driven Hollywood. That being said I found it to be a nice change of pace. (Just so you know, I am 46).The acting was very good with out being over done. The action was crisp...though I am sure some of you would think that it was violent, very violent. However, it is what you would expect in a movie like this. The humor works well and is in the places where you would expect it. Again it is not over done and you never get the feeling that they are playing for laughs. It is exactly how real life would unfold. You find yourself laughing because what is happening is actually funny and in a way you can relate to it. This movie does have a story and the story does make perfect sense, you just have to let it unfold and you are rewarded. Also this movie has an excellent cast,so much better than most movies and they all do a terrific job, so much so you are sorry when the movie ends. For me Karl Urban was the draw and I was not disappointed with his performance. He actually made feel that he enjoyed every thing about giving this performance in this movie, which of course made me enjoy this movie even more. All and all this movie gets a solid 10 out of 10 from me. It has action, adventure, humor, violence, and a love story well make that two love stories, how can you go wrong.

The movie is really good but what they do not tell you is that this "Movie Only" edition is also "Dolby only". There is no Master audio or DTS here. The audio is sub-par. Get the full version if audio is important to you.

I got a kick out of this film.  Now I admit that I'm a fan of all the stars and certainly that's a big reason why I enjoyed the experience.  Frankly it's why I wanted to see the film in the first place.  None of them disappointed me; they all treated their roles with just enough seriousness that you never get the feeling they're standing apart and winking at the audience.  And yet you know they're having fun.  With a big, dumb, 'splodey movie like this ('splodey, adjective, -er, -est, Full of explosions) if the cast isn't having fun, neither is the audience.

Frankly, I don't recall much of the plot.  Bruce Willis has a telephone romance going with a tired, bored woman at the Social Security office (Let me pause here just to say how refreshing it was to see that his love interest wasn't some vapid young starlet, but a smart, interesting, age-appropriate woman, played by Mary Louise Parker.  There is nothing bland about this cast, not even in the love department.  High marks there.)  He's a retired CIA operative who discovers  that someone is trying to kill him.  They manage to kill his house, and he decides it's time to hit the road, pick up his sweetie, who is probably in danger, and go talk to the rest of his old team, all of whom are in danger, too.

The rest of the film is them trying to figure out the who and why of the problem, and they do it with real class.  Really, if you're looking for some tasty mind candy, this is it.

I would highly recommened this film to anyone youll love the action atmosphere and parts with the comedy roles, the chemisty between Bruce Willis and Mary Louise Parker is amazing really makes the movie. Blu Ray or DVD, Its a comedy role movie but its all about the action behind the comedy theirs tons of shootouts explosions and some fighting, youll want the blu ray for this movie, its much better for action movies and this can be considered one. Enjoy the movie hope this review helped.

Just seeing Helen Mirren toting a gun is worth watching RED.  This is a very enjoyable escapist film full of guns and good actors.  Joining the Oscar winning "Queen" are:  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman. John Malkovich (a scene stealer), Richard Dreyfuss, Mary Louise Parker, Karl Urban, Brian Cox, Julian McMahon and Ernest Borgnine--quite an ensemble, and they give it thir all!
RED moves quickly and provides a good time.  I enjoyed it immensely!

With an ensemble cast featuring Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, Helen Mirren, Brian Cox, Carl Urban, Sarah Louise Parker, RED is a real treat for action fans. It's a light-hearted action film that doesn't take itself too seriously, with comedy and spy thriller elements thrown in, plus a dash of romance for good measure. The actors all look like they had a lot of fun making this film and I certainly had a lot of fun watching it. Bruce Willis is Frank Moses, a former CIA operative, the quintessential bad ass. Now retired and bored, he spends his days chatting with a customer service representative at the regional pension office named Sarah (Parker), until one evening when a wet team is sent to his house to kill him. He quickly dispatches his would-be assassins and races to Kansas City to protect Sarah. Someone has labeled him RED (Retired, Extremely Dangerous) and Frank sets off to uncover why while evading agent Cooper (Urban), a young CIA operative assigned to kill Frank. What follows is an entertaining old-fashioned spy adventure as Frank seeks out old allies and "gets the band together again", including Joe (Freeman), crazy man Marvin (Malkovich), ex-MI6 operative Victoria (Mirren), and Russian secret agent Ivan (Cox). Right from the beginning, I knew I was in for a good time when Frank takes the bullets from his assailants' handgun and cooks them on a frying pan, thus creating a time-delayed diversion. I've never seen that before in a movie. Sure, there's the main story of under-handed dealings and a top-secret government cover-up, but you're really here to see the good guys kick ass! The action comes quick and it comes often, including one ridiculously over-the-top shootout in a loading dock involving a pink stuffed pig and a woman in high-heels and an RPG! The story isn't particularly original, but I was more than happy to go along for the ride. The retired super agents angle has already been done in The Expendables and the Frank character is almost the same as his McClane in Die Hard. It's got the requisite elaborate spy-thriller heist stuff that is par for the course, like Mission Impossible Three and even a twist at the end that's almost required these days-- but if you've been paying attention, this won't come as a surprise. Even with this, it's very hard to hate this film, unless you are a total grinch. The cast consists of some of my favorite actors today and seeing them with guns blazing is a lot of fun. Watching Helen Mirren manning a .50 cal machine gun in a long white evening gown is almost worth the price of admission! Willis is typecast as an action hero and someone you would expect in the role of a tough guy, but the distinguished Dame Mirren is the very face of class and great fun to see outside of her usual roles. The only nit I have to pick is with Cox's bad Russian accent, however, he is still lovable as the hopeless romantic Ivan. Don't think too hard or take this film too seriously, because it certainly doesn't. The film ends happily with a silly moment. I wouldn't mind seeing a RED 2 if the studio decides to make another one. A feel good movie that is very entertaining-- highly recommended.

This review is for the movie only blu ray edition.  I am giving it a one star rating because the movie only edition shortchanges the consumer.  As indicated in some of the prior reviews, this edition only comes with a Dolby Digital 5.1 audio track.  It does not come with any High Definition audio tracks.  Most blu ray movies typically have at least one HD audio track whether its TrueDolbyHD or DTS-Master Audio so the average consumer may not be aware of this deficiency because they've come to expect High Def audio as the norm for Blu Ray movies.  If you want the DTS-MA audio track you need to pony up some extra money to get the more expensive special edition.  This is important to know for anyone who has a decent home theater set up with high definition audio and want the best sound possible.

Hundreds may die but at least no ones civil rights will be violated.

You have to kind of suspend belief at some of the scenes and situations in this action-thriller, but it was really fun to watch. It had a super cast which included Bruce Willis, Mary Louise-Parker, Helen Mirren, John Malkovich and Morgan Freeman who are all retired or semi-retired senior CIA operatives who get brought back into active duty by Bruce Willis he becomes involved with Mary Louise Parker in a long distance over the phone relationship and realizes he has to get to Kansas quickly and rescue her from the likes of Julian McMahon who plays the vice president of the United States, Richard Dreyfuss plays a bad operative who is after them. Brian Cox is great as a suave and smooth Russian counterpart.

The story is sort of convoluted and at times a little hard to figure out, but there's lots of actions and some spectacular big-time explosions that make it pretty exciting. Lots of chase scenes, explosions, tongue-in-check jokes, comedy and a good dose of romance thrown in, it's just a lot of fun. If you're a baby boomer, you'll be cheering for all of these characters and having plenty of good laughs along the way.

This movie features a wonderful cast of actors and a first-rate production, but cannot decide if it is a comedy or thriller or something else.  It wavers between very slow paced dialogue and extremely fast paced action and explosive violence.  Sometimes amusing and sometimes gripping as drama.  But, it strays beyond the line of acceptability when the main character sways like a pendulum between sympathetic, invincible hero and cold-blooded, vengeful reactionary.  Also, it goes beyond the implausible to the ridiculous in several places.
Good fun movie.  What I like most about this version, is that it was just the movie.  Didn't have to pay a lot for those extra features that we never watch anyway.

I love action flicks. What's even better about "Red" as an action flick is its cast. And this is not just any cast, but one filled only with retirement age actors (well, maybe Bruce Willis isn't quite there, but he acts as if he is). OK, maybe Mary Louise Parker isn't quite there either, but she's also excellent as Willis's love interest.

So, what's to like about an action flick starring old actors? (When one is the same age as the actors, one is allowed to call them old.)

1. Humor in an action flick? Yeah, it's been done for years--Clint Eastwood and Schwarzenegger with their punchy one-liners. This time Morgan Freeman gets the line: "We're getting the band back together." It was funny in the television promos--it's even funnier in context. Ms Parker expresses her extreme displeasure with the Willis characther--with her mouth duct-taped! While the viewer may not know the exact words behind her anger, her meaning is quite clear. It's an excellent delivery complete with facial expressions and perfect comedic timing.

2. Romance. Willis and Parker? Yes, and the actors make it work even though he is retired R-E-D (retired, extremely dangerous) and she is a seemingly mild-mannered, cubicle-retirement clerk. However, in their conversations together he learns the way to divine her heart. He reads all the romance novels she reads. She also has a true hankering to travel to exotic places. When she tells him she wants to go to Chile, he says he's been there. The thing with his travels is the reason and the time, often by cover of night and to relieve someone of his ugly, hateful life. He's been to Chile, but hasn't experienced Chile.

3. Larger than life characters.
Freeman has participated in Vietnam and Afghanistan and now is 80 years old (is Freeman really that old?) and living in a nice retirement home with his dose of excitement gained from eyeballing a beautiful, young aid's gluts. He also has stage four liver cancer.
Helen Mirren as the lovely, refined mistress of a country estate, filling her hours with baking and flower arranging--and the occasional hit. As she tells Ms Parker: "I kill people."
Karl Urban plays the adversary--a deep CIA special ops hit man. His job is to eliminate Willis's character. The reasons are eventually revealed and they are a doozy.
John Malkovich plays an over-the-top paranoid, well, an Oliver Stone type. But Malkovich is hilarious, especially showing his pleasure at Willis's storage facility filled with weapons and munitions of extreme measures.

3. An expose of the great and secret powers of the CIA. Ernest Borgnine's character and his job and its location and purpose are prime examples. But there's more.

4. Weapons galore! Fun with weapons! An example: one soldier shoots a grenade at Malkovich who uses his weapon to bat it back to the soldier who then is blown up. A fierce, red-headed, female agent calls Malkovich Grandpa. He must show her what "grandpas" can do. She shoots a small missile at him--he shoots a bullet from a handgun directly into the center of that missile, causing blow back of the explosion and getting rid of that potty mouth agent (older people don't like being reminded of their age!)

5. A serious message amid all the shenanigans: the abuse of power in whatever place for whatever reason. Richard Dreyfus plays--with great flair--a powerful villain and how his power has distorted whatever tenuous connection he may have with the human race.

6. Quirkiness (but I suppose part of the humor)--Mirren wears a lovely, long white evening gown to a presidential party bid. Later Malkovich gives her a pair of combat boots to wear for their role in taking down the powerfully corrupt. Just a little quirky! Malkovich's house is inside a car. Let me rephrase. One enters his dwelling through the trunk. That's all I'll say.

7. I could put Brian Cox in any category. As a retired Soviet spy who hasn't killed anyone in years, he is almost a scene stealer.

What a fun, fun movie (despite the various forms of violence). There's only one kiss, no, make that two (Freeman gets one) and just a few I love you's, giving this action flick a touch of heart.
For old curmudgeons like me it was hilarious. In addition, the casting was very cleaver and all were a joy to watch in action.

This  movie is a fun and exciting movie laced with comedy and action. There is never a dull moment throughout the movie; and the blu-ray special edition is well worth the money. It is definitely a must have movie.

I think you'll get many, many laughs out of RED. In the comic spirit of most of the James Bond spy movies that starred Roger Moore, this film has a great  daffy story that will make you feel almost satisfied with its ending.

It stars a wonderful ensemble cast of your favorites and mine--Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, and Helen Mirren--playing aging, retired spies who are confronting a powerful enemy. Mary-Louise Parker as the love-interest is a comic delight in a different way, Brian Cox is quite amusing as a very helpful elderly Soviet spy, and  Karl Urban does an excellent job in his role as an intense young adversary. It is great to watch the gang (including senior citizen Ernest Borgnine) going through their various schticks.

The movie is based on some graphic novel I've never heard of, but neither have most other viewers. If I had to guess the authors, I would immediately pick that well-known team of old-timers who used to work for the Ethiopian Ministry of Information--Haile Implausible and Haile Amusing.

SEMI-SPOILER ALERT: As in SPACE COWBOYS and ARMAGEDDON, one of 'em dies to save the others, and I won't say who or when or how--but if you know the movie industry's "rules," you can guess 1/3 of this.

ADVICE: This is great fun when viewed alone--but you'll have even more fun if you watch it with one or two good friends. Just agree beforehand on who gets to hold the remote to pause it, replay scenes in slow-mo, and turn up the volume.

I HAD WANTED TO SEE THIS MOVIE SINCE I HAD SEEN THE PREVIEWS, BUT WITH MY LIFE WORK,KIDS,AND NO BABY SITTERS. I WAITED FOR THE DVD TO COME OUT AND ORDERED IT. LETS JUST SAY I WAS NOT DISAPPOINTED AND ENJOYED THE MOVIE OVER AND OVER A AGAIN.  I REALLY LIKED MARY LOUISE PARKER'S PART IN THE MOVIE. SO I WOULD GIVE THESE MOVIE 3 THUMBS UP IF I HAD A 3RD THUMB.

This movie delivered on what the previews said it would. It was action from the start with about 5 minutes of dialog at the beginning.  If you are looking for an action flick with a little government conspiracy intertwined, check it out. It's not an "Enemy of the State" but it still satisfied my thirst for government conspiracy.

i would gladly review this film if i ever receive it.....
i try to find out wher it is but no success.....

I have always been a big Bruce Willis fan, and Morgan Freeman is my favorite actor, so it makes since that this movie would be a hit for me. There are a couple of parts where I get so involved and excited that I sit up and want to join in the fun. It's funny and full of action. What more could you want!?!

Everything they say about this movie is true!
Retired, Extremely Dangerous ex-CIA agents is/are hilarious!
Best movie of farce this year. Don't even think of missing it.

I stupidly ordered this without realizing it only has Dolby Digital.  I ASSUMED this was a thing of the past and all new Blurays would have HD audio.  Big mistake.  Next time instead of trying to save a few $$$ at Amazon I will buy it locally.  For a few dollars more I could have had the 'real' version.

BTW - The movie was excellent.

RED is one of those movies that is so exceedingly rare these days: an action comedy with no grand ambitions, no desire other than to entertain the socks right off your feet.  At this, the film excels spectacularly.  It concerns the retired (extremely dangerous) CIA agent Frank Moses, who one night finds a hit squad in his house.  Determined to track down who's behind the attempted hit, Moses rounds up some old friends, and together they decide to take on the CIA and potentially the entire US government.  Sound like a good time?  You bet it is!

Without the spectacular cast (all of whom are delightfully hamming it up), the film would still be enjoyable.  With this cast, it borders on one of the best action comedies of recent years.  Bruce Willis, Morgan Freeman, Helen Mirren, and John Malkovich are all top-notch as retired agents with a little bite left in them.  Joining them for the ride is a delightfully cool and sinister Karl Urban, as the man pursuing Moses; Marie-Louise Parker, charming and hilarious, as Moses's love interest; Brian Cox as a former Russian spy; Ernest Borgnine as a records keeper; and Richard Dreyfus as a shady businessman.

The characters are two dimensional, and the plot is shallow and convoluted.  Various plot holes aren't resolved, and the trailers gave away a lot of great moments plot details (though don't worry, there are still plenty of others).  These may seem like minor things in an action movie, but in a film with this great a cast, you notice them.  That's the only reason RED gets 4 instead of 5 stars.  Otherwise, it is an upbeat, fun, funny action film, one of those rare pieces of popcorn entertainment that warrants repeated viewing.

Yes, the plot isn't all that fresh, but so what.  It's quite funny, and the casting is great.  While I loved all of the characters, I think Mary Louise Parker shines with her loopy, adventure-deprived conversion to mayhem and chaos. If you want dark reality, watch Patriot Games, Day of the Jackal or any other of many.  This one is entertaining and amusing.  Having had an uncomfortably close stint of employment with the secret squirrels in Washington DC, I can assure those who care that the excess of paranoic, law-defying, unquestioning sociopaths and psychopaths in all the various permutations in what is now euphemistically called Homeland Security is far from off the mark.  If the average Joe Citizen had any idea who's supposed to be defending our righteous way of life and what really goes on, he/she would fall on his/her sword.

Previews looked good for this movie.  That's about all that is good.  I was very disappointed.  Just not what I thought it was.  It took well over half an hour just for me to find one good thing in the movie.  Then, it was flat-line.  There are no realy highs or lows its just flat line.

is one of those movies where you aren't really given a direct story line to follow up front.  You sort of have to piece it together as you go along.  And as the layers to the plot are discovered, you have a good laugh and lots of fun and surprises along the way.

Bruce Willis plays Frank Moses, an ex CIA agent whose file has been stamped RED - Retired, Extremely Dangerous.  He lives a quiet life on a quiet street, ripping up his pension check just so he can call in and speak to the lovely Sarah Ross (Mary-Louise Parker) at the Pension office.  They talk about books and traveling, and then Frank's house gets shot up by the bad FBI guys.  Frank kicks butt and gets the heck out of there.

After picking up Sarah, who might find herself in trouble with the CIA just for talking to him, he sets out to find why he's suddenly become a target.  Along the way, he reconnects with some old, but deadly, colleagues played by Morgan Freeman, John Malkovich, and Helen Mirren. Together, they find out the black-ops are out to kill a list of people who were present in Guatemala when the now Vice President committed war crimes.  With his plan to run for President, he needs to get rid of some dirty laundry, and Frank's name is on the laundry list.

John Malkovich is superb as a crazed gunman who fears everyone is out to get him - the government, the web, the satellites, the helicopters flying over. The government tests involving daily injections of LSD back in the day didn't help much!  The gun chases are over the top hilarious thanks to John, his big guns, and classic one liners!
